Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Simón se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café,variedad Catimor,con una experiencia en el rubro de más de 15 años.Además se desempeña como peón agrícola. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y cultivo de pan llevar.Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de abonos y gastos de dehierbos para su finca.De esta manera poder obtener un mejor rendimiento de sus cultivos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Simón es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, este es su cuarto crédito.
texts.en:
Simón, 53 years old, is partnered and lives with his partner and three children, in the district of Pomahuaca, Jaén province, Cajamarca department, in the country of Peru. Simón has very good personal and work references from the inhabitants of the zone. The people in this locality work mostly in agriculture, trade, and raising animals.

Simón works in agriculture, specifically in growing Catimor variety coffee, with over 15 years of experience in the field. In addition, he works as a agricultural laborer. Further, he works raising cattle and growing food. He asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of manure and the costs of weeding his farm. In this way, he will be able to get better results from his crops and improve his quality of life.

Simón is a return borrower for Edpyme Alternativa, this is his fourth loan.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of manure and the expenses of weeding for his farm.

loans.name: Mayna

texts.ru: Это женщина Майна. Она из района Хуросон. Майна 49 летняя мать четверых детей. Ее дети взрослые и талантливые. Старший сын занимается мастером по ремонту домов. Младшие помогает маме, и работают на земле. Жители района Хуросон активные и трудолюбивые. Хуросон, район для развития сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Там много воды и много поле для пасти животных и солнечный район. Майна 20 лет своей жизни занята животноводческой деятельности. У нее есть коровник для выращивания мелко рогатого скота. Майна мечта о увеличения поголовья скота. Путем увеличения численность скота расшириться ее деятельность. Майна верит в Вас и по этой причине она просит Вас дать ей кредит.
texts.en:
This is Mayna. She is from the region of Khuroson, and is a 49 year-old mother of four. Her children are now adult, and very talented. Her oldest son works as a housing repair specialist, and her youngest helps his mother and works on the land.

Residents of the Khuroson region are active and hard-working. Khuroson is an area for agricultural development. It is a sunny place, where there is a lot of water and fields for animals to graze. Mayna has spent 20 years of her life in agricultural work. She has a cowshed for rearing small livestock. Mayna dreams of increasing her herd; by increasing the number of cattle, she will be able to expand her work. Mayna has faith in you, and for that reason she is asking that you give her a loan.

loans.use: to buy small livestock.

loans.name: Susuruka Group

texts.en:
Fred is 32 years old and is married with three children who are between 1 and 7 years old. He is well-known in the business of restaurant which he has been doing for about five years. Fred is the president of this group SUSURUKA; he is the one who raised up his hand. This is the third cycle to request loan in Vision Finance Company and they are paying their loans very well.

Fred's hours of selling food are from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day and currently he has one employee to help him in his business. He wants to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of food such as beans, rice, bananas etc to cook in his restaurant.

With the profit from this loan, Fred will be able to purchase enough food for the family, to buy new clothes for the children, to pay school fees for his children, to buy medical insurance for his family and to renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of food such as beans, rice, bananas etc to cook in her restaurant.

loans.name: Dean Group

texts.en:
Dean is a 33-year-old married rice farmer with five children in her care who resides in a Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Dean is pictured 1st from the right and has cultivated rice since 2002. Her two children are factory workers and another two children attend school. Her husband is a 55-year-old construction worker. Together, they can make approximately USD 6.5 per day.

Dean as group leader, would like to request a loan as a group of six members to buy fertilizer for rice farming. With this loan, she will be able to gain better rice crops to sell, thereby improving the family’s finances. In the future, she is going to save money to buy more farmland to cultivate rice, renovate her house and support her children to earn high diplomas.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for rice farming

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc for her restaurant business.

Nancy has been in this business for 4 years. Nancy earns more income from general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business and save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Rowena is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alda

texts.en:
Alda is requesting a loan of $ 1.000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as rice, noodles, salt, sugar, milks, cooking oils, wheat, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell. Because she wants to get the items according to people like.

Alda started to open her kiosk in 2005 with her own working capital of $1000.00. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, salt, sugar, milks, cooking oils, wheat, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Vasquez San Miguel Group

texts.en:
The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge combines loans with education to help women expand their businesses and learn practical applicable lessons on topics including business, health and self-esteem. On average a client with Friendship Bridge has 2.6 years of formal education and cannot read nor write.

The Department of Totonicapán, located in the Western Highlands, is the site of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Vasquez San Miguel. Ten women are in the group and the President is 48 year old Juana. She has a lot of responsibility, not only in the Trust Bank but also in her family. Juana is a widow and has eight children. She learned how to weave traditional skirts called “cortes” from her husband and it is her business. Juana wants to expand her business and has requested a loan to buy a loom, thread, dye and other essential weaving supplies.

Education is very important to the women, especially for their children. It is a very high priority for Juana that her children receive a good education. Three of the eight are in elementary school. She is a good role model for the other women in the Trust Bank. The ladies help each other overcome obstacles together, learn valuable life skills and share what they learn with each other and their families.

KIVA investors are greatly appreciated by the women for their generosity and kindness in funding these much-needed loans. With their new tools, the women are poised to step into a brighter future, benefitting themselves, their families and their community in Totonicapan, Guatemala. Thank you!

loans.use: to buy a loom, thread, dye and other essential weaving supplies.

loans.name: Tirsa

texts.en:
Tirsa is a fish vendor from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She has been selling fish for a long period of time, catering locals in her place. 
She is forty-five years old married woman and has nine children. Five of her children are still attending school.
 Her husband is a fisher man and does construction works as well.

Tirsa  needs funds to support her existing project. She has requested a loan  to purchase assorted fish, cellophane, styro foam (fish storage) and ice. It could boost her income and continue to handle it properly. Thus, support her family and provide a comfortable home.

In the future, she is looking forward to become productive as she would able to continue improve the family's living condition with the help of his husband.

loans.use: to purchase assorted fish, cellophane, styro foam (fish storage) and ice

loans.name: Kay

texts.en:
Challenges in business like unhealthy competition and insufficient capital do not exempt any entrepreneur; like Kay, a loyal partner of CCT since 2013, who has always been dedicated to growing her "ukay-ukay" business year after year. She may have experienced ups and downs while operating her store, but discouragement could never hold her back in pursuing her life goals.

The love for family consistently drives her to keep moving forward toward her dreams. She has been running her business for 10 fruitful years already, and by carefully meeting the demand of customers, Kay was able to gain more patrons and significantly increased her sales. As of today, her net earnings add up to almost PHP 36,000 per month, and she expects to further increase them in the next few years.

She needs additional capital to buy more stocks of used clothes to sell. She will use the loan to purchase additional varieties of pants, shorts, t-shirts, dresses and children's wear. A loan amounting to PHP 23,000 will suffice for this, and she is thanking you in advance for whatever amount you will lend her.

Kay still regularly meets with her co-fellowship members every week where she get inspiration and wisdom of God’s undeserved grace and love. CCT’s approach is wholistic and transformative, giving emphasis to the importance of the integral work of God in the communities they serve.

loans.use: to procure boxes of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en: Norberta has been involved in activities since 2013. She started her business with her own working capital of $250.00. Her husband is agriculture. So she is requesting a loan of $1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional supplies according to people like, including rice, candles, eggs, Aqua, ice, noodles, cooking oils, detergents, biscuits, coffee, milk and other things to sell Including soft drinks and hard drinks. She hopes to make her business bigger in the future.

loans.use: to buy, rice, candles, eggs, Aqua, ice, noodles, cooking oils, detergents, biscuits, coffee, milk , soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 35 years old, married with two children.

Amy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Amy has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and food vending.

Amy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
Sor, 50, is a resident in Kampong Cham province and a married mother of five children, two of whom account on her. Income of this family comes from fishing, selling grocery items in factory and working for others for a fee. Personal illness costs Sor to spend much money on treatment service.
This is the first time for her to ask for loan support from VisionFund. She, the group leader of four-member group, is going to use her loan to buy some grocery items to replenish the store to attract customers. She hopes that she can earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to replenish the store so as to make a better living.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Met's Group

texts.en: Met’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Met works as teacher and she also does extra work as electrician and seller  to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Taona

texts.en:
At 26 years old, Taona is the youngest in a family of four. She has a degree in Tourism and is passionate about business management. Her dream is to run her own business, but lack of capital is a huge obstacle in making this dream a reality. The biggest contributing factor to her wanting to run a successful business is the fact that she would like to use the funds generated to put her four siblings through school.

Currently, the economy in Malawi makes it difficult for young people to find gainful employment. This makes it difficult for Taona to support herself and her family. She believes that becoming a Zoona agent and running her own business will turn her situation around.

She would like to make a success of running a mobile money transfer business in Lilongwe and eventually use the revenue generated to further her education and plow all that knowledge back into her business and her community. She loves working with people and she would like to use her business to create employment opportunities for others.
On a broader spectrum, Taona would like to be able to give back to her community by not only creating employment opportunities and thus helping others achieve peace of mind, but also to be a viable, trustworthy alternative in a country where banking is simply too expensive for most of the working class.

This would not only save her community member’s time, but it would also lower their expenses as this would reduce the need to travel long distances in order to send and receive money.
One of her objectives is to take safe money transfer facilities to the community, and clients no longer having to spend on travel would make this a reality as well as improve the overall customer experience. She would like to increase her Zoona footprint in Malawi.
Zoona has done market research and in so doing have found that, with Lilongwe being the largest city in Malawi, the location in which Taona is looking to open her outlet would be ideal not only for employment opportunities for that community, but also to generate the traction she envisions for her business.
Taona thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to procure a branded Zoona trolley and an internet enabled phone as well as the funds needed to make the actual transactions so that she can start running her own business.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is a 45 year’s old married woman living with her husband and two children, still attending school. Her husband represents the main income source in the family in order to satisfy the family needs. And as for her she is a housewife taking care of her family only. Today, in order to pay her children’s educational fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to register them with the coming school year. Her only target is to see them pursuing his education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells eggs, cereals, parrafin. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals, eggs, paraffin and other items. His business goal is to own a cereals depot within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have increased income. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals, eggs, paraffin and other items.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a single woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour,milk and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, rice and other items. Her business goal is to own a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, rice and other items.

loans.name: Ma. Christy

texts.en:
Christal is 17 years old and is 1st of four children in the family. Her mother Ma. Christy a member of NWTF, supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Christal is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration and is currently in the 2nd of this 2-year course.

Ma. Christy is borrowing PHP 7600 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter Christal for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When she graduates, Christal plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition fees, for her BSc. in Business Administration

loans.name: Kimhann

texts.en:
A 26-year-old married woman, Kimhann is a resident in Siem Reap province. She is blessed with three dependent children, two of whom are in school while the remaining one is under the age of school. She supports her family by growing rice, raising three cows and providing speaker rental service (used at weddings and other celebrations). She earns about USD8 per day and can save about USD2 each day. Obstacles to rice growing business are flood and overgrown weeds in farmland.
This is the third cycle loan for her with VisionFund; past loans have helped her improve the living condition and send her children to school. For this cycle, she will use her loan to buy speakers to support her speaker rental business. She hopes she can earn more income to upgrade the standard of living and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy speakers to support her speaker rental business so that she can support her children’s education.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 48 year old divorcee who bought a school a year and a half ago because she identified a lack of functioning schools for students in her area. She wanted to turn the existing school into a more functional and profitable venture and to meet these aims she has taken a loan for PKR 200,000.

With this money she will buy new furniture for the students and repair the building to be a more conducive environment for learning. Kalsoom's school is in a relatively poor community and many children's parents do not have a stable income to pay fees, but she wants to continue to provide quality education to the children and enhance their learning environment by hiring more teachers in the future.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for the students at her school and repair the building to be a more conducive environment for learning.

loans.name: Mukammal

texts.ru: Мукаммал трудолюбивая и ответственна девушка из городка Исфары. Ей 49 лет. У нее трое детей. Мукаммал занимается шитьем женской одежды. Муж и сын работают в Российской Федерации. Скоро у семьи Мукаммал состоится мероприятие по случаю отрезания внука. В Таджикистане это событие масштабное и к ним придет много гостей. Провести такое мероприятие расходное и Мукаммал обращается за кредитом, чтобы ее поддержали. Она надеется, ей помогут, и мероприятие пройдет на высшем уровне.
texts.en:
Mukammal is a hard-working and responsible woman from the town of Isfara. She is 49 years old, and has three children. Mukammal works sewing women's clothes, and her husband and son work in Russia. Soon, Mukammal's family will host an event to mark her grandson's circumcision.

In Tajikistan, this is a huge event and many guests will come. To hold such an event is expensive, and Mukammal is applying for a loan for support. She hopes that it will help, and that the event will be held at the highest standard.

loans.use: to hold an event for her grandson's circumcision.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia is a 61 -year-old widow woman with two children. One of her child is still attending school. For the past 20 years, she started working in the rice paddies to cater the needs and expenses of her children. She grows and sold rice to the local dwellers in her place.
Aside from rice farming, she also engaged in selling bottled mineral water, which is very important commodity nowadays.

She is very industrious woman who is trying desperately to develop her livelihood, but she is also a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children.
Sergia has requested a loan to purchase farms paraphernalia like fertilizers , sprayer and stocks of mineral water.

She hopes to expand her business more in the future through expanding her both livelihood to increase her income and able to continue finance the schooling of her child.

loans.use: to purchase  farms paraphernalia like fertilizers , sprayer and stocks of mineral water

loans.name: Rola

texts.en: Rola is a 40 year old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and two children who are still studying. She is a housewife taking care of her children all the time, as per her husband, he is the main income provider in the family and working so hard to help his beloved family to live in good conditions. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees and to register them at school. The parents’ only target is to provide their children with a good educational path until graduation.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees and to register them at school

loans.name: Maria Piedad

texts.es:
Maria, es una mujer ama de casa, actualmente vive con su esposo y uno de sus 5 hijos, pero están pasando por una difícil situación económica debido a que ella no tiene empleo y, por falta de experiencia laboral le ha quedado difícil encontrar oportunidades de trabajo.

Maria es una mujer emprendedora, tiene visión y ganas de salir adelante, por lo que se motiva para solicitar su primer ciclo de crédito, el cual invertirá en el pago de un curso de capacitación en Cocina Fusión, ya que le gusta todo lo relacionado con la gastronomía y desea tener más conocimientos para poder tener más oportunidades laborales y así obtener ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades básicas del hogar. 

Maria sueña con capacitarse y a mediano plazo convertirse en una gran cocinera, montar su propio restaurante y tener un excelente equipo de trabajo, que permitan hacer el negocio próspero y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is a housewife. She currently lives with her husband and one of their five children. She is experiencing a difficult financial situation because she does not have a job. Because of her lack of work experience, it has been difficult to find work opportunities. Maria is an enterprising woman who has vision and the desire to get ahead.

Therefore, she is motiated to request her first loan cycle. She will use the loan to pay for a training course in Fusion Cooking. She likes everything having to do with cuisine. She wishes to have more knowledge in order to be able to have more work opportunities. This way she will get income to meet the basic household needs.

Maria dreams of being trained and, in the medium term, of becoming a great cook. She dreams of setting up her own restaurant and having excellent work equipment that will allow her to make her business prosper and to be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for training in fusion cooking.

loans.name: Nelly Del Carmen

texts.es:
A sus 70 años de edad Nelly logró consolidar un negocio de confección a terceros y línea propia de ropa gracias a la experiencia que obtuvo trabajando en varios talleres, trabaja de lunes a sábado entre 9 y 11 horas diarias dependiendo la cantidad de trabajo y sabe que gracias a sus clientes tiene un buen negocio. 

Quiere ampliar sus horizontes y lograr ofrecer trabajo a las personas más necesitadas por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como hilos, tela, agujas, entre otros con la que podrá mejorar su producción, expandirse a nuevas empresas, y aumentar  su volumen de trabajo; dándole así, la oportunidad a una persona de trabajar. 

Su sueño es seguir creciendo y conformar un taller y así, contar la historia de que gracias a los colaboradores y prestadores del portal Kiva y a la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar pudo montar un gran negocio.
texts.en:
At 70 years old, Nelly managed to consolidate a business of outsourced tailoring and her own shop making clothing thanks to the experience she acquired working in various other shops. She works Monday through Saturday between 9 and 11 hours per day, depending on the work load; she knows that thanks to all her customers, she has a good business.

She would like to broaden her horizons and offer work to the people who need it the most, so she is requesting a loan to purchase supplies such as threads, fabric, needles, etc. so she can improve her production, expand to service more companies, and increase her work volume; and in this way give someone a job opportunity.

Her dream is to continue growing and create her own shop, and then tell everyone about how thanks to Kiva's supporters and with the help of the Corporación Interactuar, she was able to build a wonderful business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as threads, fabric, needles, etc. so she can improve her production.

loans.name: Orwiina Twegeite Group

texts.en:
Hope is 40 years old, a first time borrower with UGAFODE Microfinance LTD.She has applied for a loan of ugx.1,000,000/= through Orwina Twegeite group for house completion. She is married to Richard and they have five children and all are in school. She is engaged in agriculture as her main source of income as well as a resident of Orwina village, Ntungamo district. She's thankfull to Ugafofde and Kiva lenders for their support towards her needs and her fellow group members.
The lady at the extreme right wearing a badge the the UGAFODE Credit staff in charge of the group.

loans.use: buy Irion sheets to roof her house

loans.name: Akanyenyeri Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 25 years old and married, with two children. He is the president of the group AKANYENYERI in local language and in English means STAR. Emmanuel has raised his hand. Emmanuel sells vegetable and books, pens, sugar, rice etc. He has ten years of experience in this work and currently has two people to help him in his business. He works from 8 a.m until 7 p.m every day.

Emmanuel has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods like: books, pens, sugar, rice etc for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future, to pay school fees for his children, to pay medical insurance for the family.

loans.use: to purchase various goods like: books, pens, sugar, rice etc for resale.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
A senhora Cristina, tem 61 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 04 filhos dos quais 02 estão na sua responsabilidade e 02 estão nos lares. Para além dos seus filhos, sustenta o seu neto que frequenta o ensino secundário.
É negociante e com o empréstimo vai reforçar o seu negócio comprando cadeiras plásticas, bacias, duvés, lençois, camas e outros utensílhos para reforçar seu negócio.
Sonha  em desenvolver o negócio e adquirir uma viatura para facilitar nas deslocações. Seu desafio é trabalhar muito mais para almejar os seus desejos.
texts.en:
Cristina is 61 years old. She is widowed and mother of 4 children, 2 of whom live with her, and 2 who have their own homes. In addition to her children, she supports her grandson who attends secondary school.

She is a merchant and with this loan she will restock her business selling plastic chairs, bowls, duvets, sheets, beds, and other items.

Her dream is to develop her business and to purchase a vehicle to make it easier to get around. Her challenge is to work a lot more to get what she wants.

loans.use: to purchase plastic chairs, bowls, duvets, sheets, beds, and other items to stock her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be energetic. She operates a retail business where she sells water. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be water shortage. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy another water tank to store water for sell. Her business goal is to have a bigger business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to invest in farming.

loans.use: to buy another water tank for her water sales business

loans.name: Elena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Elena es una campesina de 49 años de edad, madre de 5 hijos. Durante toda su vida productiva se ha dedicado a las labores del campo y actualmente cría, engorda y comercializa cerdos. 

Se levanta muy temprano en las mañanas para alimentar sus animales y luego se dirige a un estadero cercano a su vivienda, donde trabaja como empleada para complementar los ingresos.

 Ambas actividades le han permitido construir poco a poco la casa donde vive y los chiqueros donde tiene los cerdos. 

La cliente es una mujer amable y trabajadora siempre motivada por sus hijos, por los que lucha incansablemente para sacarlos adelante. 

Solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar lechones y para realizar adecuaciones a los chiqueros, de esta manera podrá aumentar la producción para satisfacer la alta demanda que crece en la temporada navideña y así poder generar mejores ingresos personales para el su propio sustento y el de sus hijos. 

Todo esto se reflejará en mayor liquidez económica para seguir avanzando y en un futuro cercano poder cumplir el sueño de ampliar su negocio, ampliando el espacio y la cantidad de animales para mejorar su rentabilidad y poder disfrutar de una vejez más tranquila, realizando la labor que disfruta.
texts.en:
Elena, age 49, is a farmer, and she has five children. She has done farm work during all of her productive life. She currently raises, fattens, and sells pigs. She gets up very early in the morning to feed the animals. She then goes to a store near her house where she works in order to supplement her earnings. Both activities have allowed her to build, little by little, the house where she lives and the pigsties where she has the pigs.

She is a kind and hard-working woman who is always motivated for her children. She struggles tirelessly in order to get them ahead.

She is requesting the support of the loan to buy piglets and to make repairs to the pigsties. This way she will be able to increase production to meet the high demand that grows during the Christmas season. This way she will be able to generate better personal income for her sustenance and that of her children.

All of this will be reflected in greater financial liquidity in order to continue advancing. In the near future she will be able to fulfill her dream of expanding her business and expanding the space and quantity of animals. She will do this in order to improve her profitability and to be able to enjoy a more peaceful old age doing the work that she enjoys.

loans.use: to buy piglets and to make repairs to the pigsties.

loans.name: Nghĩa

texts.en:
Mrs Nghĩa is 28 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for 5 years. Nghĩa lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to enjoy her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Nghĩa first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.

In the future, Nghĩa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: Manuel has build his home a few years ago, with his own working capital and until now his house has not been completed because his money is not enough, so now he is requesting a loan of $ 1,500.00 from the Tuba Rai Metin to buy more materials like paint, brushes, rollers, door frames, window sills, trellises, glass., because he plans to completed his home. He is very happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for his, because this loan can help him to complete his house.

loans.use: to complete his house and buy paint, brushes, rollers, door frames, window sills, trellises, glass.

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province, La is 36 years old and a married mother of four children, three of whom are schoolchildren and one is under age of school. Nowadays, she has been growing rice for 18 years to support her family’s living. Moreover, she has worked for others for a fee to earn more income. Insects on her farm caused her to get lower output than before.

Due to lacking of working capital, she is now leading a group of two to apply for a loan with VisionFund to buy pesticide and fertilizer to grow her rice, which is expected to produce good yields. She hopes to make more income so that she can afford to buy school supplies to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer to grow her rice, which are expected to produce good yields. .

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Franio Erasmo

texts.es:
Franio, a sus 24 años de edad, es casado y padre de 1 hija. Toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo, donde actualmente posee una producción de ganado bovino; adicionalmente, complementa sus ingresos con la agricultura; de esta manera logra generar los ingresos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar. 

El cliente se caracteriza por su pujanza, su dinamismo y actitud positiva con la que enfrenta la vida, lo que la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para comprar 2 vacas, con las que podrá reemplazar a dos animales que están en periodo de gestación; esto le permitirá mantener su producción al mismo nivel y no perderá los recursos económicos que éstas le generan. 

De esta forma, Franio desea seguir luchando incansablemente para seguir avanzando en sus negocios y espera poder cumplir el sueño de pagar la educación de su hija.
texts.en:
At 24, Franio is married and the father of a daughter. He has spent his entire life in the countryside, where he now has a business raising cows. Also he complements those earnings with agriculture; in this way he generates enough income to support his family.

Franio is known for his strong character, his dynamic nature and his positive approach to life, which has prompted him to apply for a loan to buy two cows, which will allow him to replace two animals which are pregnant. This will let him maintain his production levels and not lose any income that the cows generate. In this way, Franio would like to continue tirelessly striving to develop his businesses and fulfill his dream of paying for his daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy two cows to replace the animals he has.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana sells men's clothes at the market. Thanks to the previous loan, she purchased seasonal inventory. Tatyana is active and hardworking person and she wants to develop her business further.

This time Tatyana is asking for a loan of 18 000 UAH to increase the assortment of men's winter clothing. She wants to buy sweaters, shirts and coats.

loans.use: to purchase men's clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Cidalia

texts.pt:
A senhora Cidalia tem 31 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 02 filhos que estudam.Com  o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar produtos da 1a necessidade para revender na sua mercearia, tais como: arroz, peixe, feijão, óleo da cozinha, bolachas, refrigerantes e outros produtos básicos.
A cliente tem como sonho, ter uma loja com todos produtos básicos para satisfazer a comunidade local e, posteriormente ter gado bovino e caprino.
Enfrenta dificuldades financeiras que fazem escassear os produtos para sua actividade pelo pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
Cidalia is 31 years old. She is a widow and mother of two children who attend school. With this loan she will purchase staple items to resell at her grocery such as rice, fish, beans, cooking oil, cookies, soft drinks, and other basic goods.

Her dream is to have a store with all staple items to meet the needs of the local community and later to have cows and goats as livestock.

She faces financial difficulties which make her run low on products for her business so she is trying to borrow more times to overcome her difficulties and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase rice, fish, beans, cooking oil, cookies, soft drinks, and other basic goods.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia, who is in her early 50s is married with four children. Three are still in school and one is grown up. She has been running a genge duka business for nine years now. She works from 07am to 09pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on her genge and started the duka business. She is doing fine and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, reinvest in business, to repay loan and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase on the genge duka stock and serve more customers. She dreams of owning shops for renting.

Zakia will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to increase on the genge duka stock and serve more customers.

loans.name: Leen

texts.en:
Leen is a 21-year-old single beautiful lady from Nablus city. Her father has a small grocery store in the city where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely covers all the family needs.

Leen is a student in the local university where she studies law . She wants to take a BA degree and find a job in the future to support her country.

Leen took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay university fees for this semester. By taking this loan, Leen will be able to register at the university and pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Leen appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay university fees for the semester.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 59-year-old woman from Mahaplag, Leyte. She is married and has five adult children. She sells “bodbod” (slightly sweet sticky rice with coconut milk wrapped in banana leaves) and “moron” (is a milk and chocolate twisted flavored sticky rice cake wrapped in banana leaves) for more than 20 years to earn a living, while her husband works hard to provide the needs of their family. They work together for sustainability.

Lucia is asking a loan to buy food ingredients such as milk powder, chocolate powder, milled rice, coconut milk, and sugar. In the future, she wants to improve and expand her business to increase their profit. Additionally, she wishes to own a place in a market to sell her goods.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as milk powder, chocolate powder, milled rice, coconut milk, and sugar

loans.name: Makram

texts.en: Makram is a 19 year old single man. He is living with his parents and one sibling still attending school. His parents are is the main income source in the family in order to satisfy their needs and to be always ready to fulfill their children demands. Due to the hard financial situation, today, he is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l; he will be utilizing the loan to pay his study fees. In the future, he plans to take new Kiva loans and keep on covering his study fees.

loans.use: to pay his study fees

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Mrs Han is 55 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture growing vegetable crops for 3 years. Han lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. So the income from this job is not high enough to do what she really needs to enjoy her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Han first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.

In the future, Han hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Madiha

texts.en:
Madiha is a 38-year-old Lebanese married woman of three children’s who has been working since 2011 in the agriculture sector. She likes her occupation so much because she likes to feel her independence. Her husband has his own business as a blacksmith and they cooperate to collect enough money to be able to pay the heavy life expenses.

Today, she is applying to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase seeds and agriculture tools for her business in order to improve it. She is very positive about her future and wishes to ameliorate her lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and agriculture tools

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 34 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. Her business is operating a quarry. She has been in the business for two years. She earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to diversify into selling vegetables. She will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business.

loans.use: to diversify into selling vegetables.

loans.name: Crescenciana

texts.en:
Crescenciana is 75 years old. Crescenciana owns and operates an agricultural farm, growing coconuts, bananas and other crops for a living. Crescenciana has been engaged in this business for many years with the help of her husband who also works on the farm, and she earns well from these activities.

Her farm is doing well and yet she needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has 4 children. He operates a farm where he grows coffee, bananas and other crops. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a good place and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate rain.

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. His business goal is to have a large farm within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his farm.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, soap, bread, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His primary customers are regular.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items.

loans.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. His business goal is to expand business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have increased income. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Shirley Johana

texts.es:
A sus 40 años, Shirley tiene mucha energía y empuje para trabajar en su negocio de café internet desde su casa.

Vive en una humilde casa con su compañero sentimental y con sus 3 hijos a quienes enseña el valor del trabajo duro y el valor del cuidado a la familia.
Actualmente enfrenta problemas en su negocio como la inseguridad en el sector.

Esto intenta contrarrestarlo ofreciendo un servicio de calidad para que los clientes no dejen de visitarla.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de un computador y una mesa para ubicarlo.
texts.en:
At 40 years old, Shirley has a great deal of energy, and works hard running her internet cafe business out of her home.
She lives in a humble home with her partner and her three children, who she is teaching the value of hard work, and the value of taking care of your family.

Right now she is facing some challenges with her business, such as insecurity in the sector. She is trying to overcome that by offering a high-quality service to her customers so they do not stop coming. She is requesting a loan to purchase a computer and a table for it.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a table for it.

loans.name: Colette Eliane

texts.fr:
Colette a 29 ans, elle est mariée. Le couple a deux enfants (10-6ans)et ils sont scolarisés dans une école primaire privée. Le conjoint a également choisi le petit commerce comme activité. Le couple n’hésite pas à saisir les opportunités quand le marché d’un produit existe.
Colette vend des téléphones et des accessoires. Elle dispose d’un point de vente sur le marché. Elle a obtenu un premier crédit pour cette même activité au mois de Mai 2015. Elle est actuellement à son deuxième prêt pour l’extension de l’activité. Avant cette activité, elle vendait des fleurs. Le choix de la vente de téléphone se justifie par l’existence d’un marché sûr et en pleine croissance. C’est une activité rentable à l’heure actuelle.
La famille vit dans une maison louée. Le rêve est de pouvoir construire une maison à partir de l’épargne constituée.
texts.en:
Colette is twenty-nine years old and married. The couple has two children (ten and six years old) who both attend a private primary school. Both Colette and her husband are street traders and are quick to sell new products in response to market demand. Colette sells mobile phones and accessories from a location in the market.

Collette received her first loan for her business in May 2015, she has now requested a second loan to expand this business. Previously, she sold flowers but began selling phones as the market was booming. She makes a good living from her business.

Currently, the family lives in a rented house but their dream is to build their own home using their savings.

loans.use: to buy chargers, batteries, new and second-hand portable phones.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Esther. She is forty six years old, married and a mother five children. She has undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise development, that has enabled her to manage her enterprise.

Esther operates a green grocer kiosk, selling vegetables to earn a living. She is taking a Kiva loan to add more stock to her grocery. She looks forward to more sales, leading to higher returns. She will use the anticipated income to cater to family needs such as food and clothing.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables, to boost sales and thus produce more income.

loans.name: Kalyan Group

texts.en:
Kalyan is 41 years old, a married woman with three children. She fattens animals for sale and she has been in this work since 2010. Three of her children are students. Her husband is 40 years old, a member of a consultant team at the Commune Hall. All of them live in Prey Veng Province of Cambodia.

Kalyan and her husband can earn approximately $3.5 per day. Kalyan is pictured 1st from the right, she is a group leader. She would like to request a loan as a group of five members and she will use her portion to buy wood to build a cow stable for her cows. With this loan, she will be able to have enough place for her cows, thereby improving the family’s finances.

In the future, she is going to save money to buy more cows and pigs to sell, and support her three children to get higher education.

loans.use: to buy wood to build a cow stable for her cows.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en: Genelyn is a 35-year-old woman who is a mother of three children, ages 10, 8 and 6 years old. She and her family live in the town of Mahaplag in Leyte, Philippines. Genelyn earns a living by selling food in the communities. She and her husband work together to provide for the needs of their family and to sustain each day. Genelyn is requesting a loan to buy food ingredients such as flour, spices, meat, cooking oil, and vegetables. In the future, she hopes to open a sari-sari (variety) store to enhance her family’s livelihood.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as flour, spices, meat, cooking oil, and vegetables

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
O senhor Alberto tem 37 anos de idade, casado e pai de 03 filhos dos quais uma frequenta o ensino primário e os restantes não tem idade escolar. Trabalha como assentador da via ferrovía. Está a  construir a sua habitação e com o empréstimo, vai comprar cimento, varrões, blocos estribos para dar continuidade na as obras da sua casa.
Este, sonha em concluir a sua casa e dar maior conforo a sua familia e o desafio  é terminar o emprestimo sem entrar em moras de modo a desembolsar mais
texts.en:
Alberto is 37 years old. He is married and has 3 children, one who attends primary school and two who are not yet school-aged. He works laying rails for the railroad. He is building his home and with this loan he will purchase cement, bars, and block brackets to continue construction on his home.

He dreams of finishing his house to provide more comfort to his family. His challenge is to finish paying the loan without delays so that he can request another.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, and block brackets to continue construction on his home.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as visionary. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 48 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. Her business is farming and livestock keeping. She has been in the business for 10 years.

She earns a monthly income of eight thousand Kenya shillings. This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy more livestock.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to increase her savings and also service the loan. Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy life.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 28 years old. He is married and blessed with one child. His business is a retail shop. He has been in the business for five years. He earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand Kenya shillings.

This is his first term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase a stock of bread, cooking oil, salt, tomatoes and poultry for sale.

He will use the profits from the expanded business to expand his business as well as increase his savings account. His hopes and dreams are to open other branches of electrical goods shops and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of bread, cooking oil, salt, tomatoes and poultry for sale.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be determined.

She operates a retail business where she sells bananas and arrow roots, and she has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are regular. Aziza describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Aziza will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of bananas and arrow roots. She hopes that in the future, she will have increased income.

This is Aziza's sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas, arrow roots.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will have increased income. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Goshen School

texts.en:
George is the Head Teacher of Goshen Nursery & Primary School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Soroti with 550 students. Goshen School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced.

The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment system with two 450 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Goshen School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. George ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Wega Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Hannah; forty years old, married and blessed with four children. She is a member of Wega Self Help group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 and has undergone all the training modules. Hannah does maize, bean and potato farming, a business she has been doing for the last fifteen years.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase fertilizer for top dressing so that she can increase her farm produce. She plans to use the profits generated from potato sales to cater for her family's basic needs, save money for future use and plough back some to her business.

Hannah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to make payment promptly.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top dressing so that she can increase her farm produce.

loans.name: Selevest

texts.en:
Selevest is a hardworking man who operates a drug shop and also deals in coffee.

He is a married man and his greatest desire is to complete his residential house. At the moment, Selevest would love to add more stock of drugs to his shop, but he is faced with the challenge of limited capital, plus clients who take drugs on credit, given the fact that he works in a rural area.

He is requesting a credit facility to buy more drugs to sell. He will willingly repay it.

loans.use: to buy more drugs to sell.

loans.name: Sokhea's Group

texts.en: Sokhea’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokhea makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller and driver to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lauben

texts.en:
Lauben is a first time borrower aged 33 and a resident of a rural area in Rukanga- Kajara, Ntungamo district. He is an agriculturalist and mainly grows coffee that he sells to earn an income to meet his financial obligations.

Lauben is requesting for a loan of ugx2,000,000 to buy farm inputs, especially organic fertilizers so he can increase his production and sales. This will help Lauben to increase his income and start another income generating activity in the near future, so that he can adequately finance his family's financial obligations.

He thanks UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for helping him to finance his projects. He is committed to repay well to maintain the partnership.
Pictured is Lauben(centre), his wife and the UGAFODE credit staff(left).

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
The person appearing in this photo is Priscilla; 50 years old and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH-EA) in the year 2014 and has successfully undergone enterprise development and financial management training by HiH-EA.

Her economic activity is dairy farming. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy feeds for her dairy cows. She looks forward to more productivity thus more income. This will enable her to provide better clothing for her family and also pay school fees for her son.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Hantamalala Blandine

texts.fr:
Blandine  est mariée. Elle a 36 ans. L’un de ses atouts est sa capacité à accueillir les clients. Le conjoint exerce comme activité le commerce de cheptel porcin : achat de porcs en milieu rural et vente en milieu urbain  Le couple a trois enfants (16-11-8ans) scolarisés dans des écoles privées (classes de 2nde,5ème et 9ème).
Blandine  vend des téléphones et des accessoires depuis une année; elle dispose d’un point de vente sur le marché. Elle est actuellement à son deuxième prêt pour l’extension de l’activité. Le choix de la vente de téléphone se justifie par l’existence d’un marché sûr. Le marché de ces produits est en pleine expansion. Avant, elle vendait du charbon de bois.
Le rêve du couple  est de pouvoir acquérir un terrain et  construire une maison afin d’éviter de payer un loyer
texts.en:
Blandine is thirty six years old and married. She has three children (sixteen, eleven and eight years old) who all attend private schools (second grade, fifth grade and ninth grade). Her husband earns a living buying pigs from the countryside and reselling them in town. Blandine has been selling mobile phones and accessories for one year, from a location at the market. Prior to this, she sold charcoal but moved to phone sales as the market is strong and expanding rapidly.

This will be Blandine's second loan from the field partner.

The couple's dream is to buy a plot of land and build a house so they no longer have to pay rent.

loans.use: to buy chargers, batteries, SIM cards, headphones, portable telephones and other accessories.

loans.name: Abdusator

texts.ru: Это мужчина Абдусатор. Ему 51 лет. Он житель района Бохтар. Абдусатор женат и отец троих детей. Его жена работает стоматологом. Дети учиться в университете и школе. Абдусатор умный, ответственный и образованный человек. Он  работает стоматологом. Абдусатор хорошо учился в университете. Он любить делать добро и помогать людям. У Абдусатор имеется частная клиника на районе. Он работает вместе с женой. Стоматология является семейной деятельности. У Абдусатор каждый день возрастает количество клиентов, потому что он отличный стоматолог. Он решил купить новое оборудование для улучшения и расширения деятельности. Для купли оборудование у Абдусатор нет денежных средств, по этой причине он обратился к Вам за кредитом. Абдусатор верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Ему очень нужно поддержка с Вашей стороны.
texts.en:
This man is Abdusator. He is 51 years old. He is a resident of the Bohtar region. Abdusator is married and the father of three children. His wife works as a dentist. The children study at the university and go to school.

Abdusator is a smart, responsible and educated man. He works as a dentist. He did well in university. He loves to do good and to help people. Abdusator has his own clinic in the region. He works together with his wife. The dental clinic is their family business.

Abdusator is increasing the number of customers every day, because he is a good dentist. He decided to purchase new equipment to improve and expand the business. He does not have enough money to purchase the equipment, and for this reason he applied for a loan from you.

Abdusator trusts in you and your support. He needs your support very much.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to expand his dental business

loans.name: Saron Group

texts.en:
Saron, who is 51, lives with her family members in a rural village in the Prey Veng Province of Cambodia.

She is a rice farmer, and her husband is a 51-year-old rice farmer as well. Saron is pictured first from the right and has been cultivating rice since 1984. Saron and her husband can make approximately USD $3 each day.

Saron, as the leader of five members, would like to request a group loan. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for rice farming. With this loan, she will be able to gain better rice crops to sell, thereby improving her family’s finances.

In the future, she is going to save money to buy cows to breed for calves to sell, and she will be able to build a new and proper house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for rice farming

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
Wafa is 26-year-old woman from Jabalia City, married and mother to two children. Wafa was living with her family in a small humble house, but during the latest war on Gaza her house was destroyed completely She had to rent a small apartment in the same area.

Recently Wafa took a USD loan from Palestine for credit and Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild her old house. The loan will allow Wafa to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return her family to their normal life.
Wafa appears in the photo.

loans.use: in order to rebuild her old house, which was destroyed in war.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
Adolat was born in 1972. She is married and has two children.

Her husband is a businessman. Adolat also has been busy with her own business buying and selling food items. She sells variety of food items such as rice, milk products, dried fruits, etc. Adolat has a store which is located in her house.

She is going to increase working capital and in this way attract more customers. Adolat is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy rice and dried fruits. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy food items to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 60 years old, separated and has eight children. She lives in Dela Paz Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. She owns a farm and is doing well, earning a good income for her family.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used for fertilization of her farm. With her new investment, she took a new loan to finance mushroom production to sell to the village while she was waiting for the next cropping. She wants to improve her farm as well as her new investment in mushroom production. Her future plan is to renovate her home to provide safe living quarters for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings to support mushroom production on her farm.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy animal feeds. Her business goal is to have high breed of cows within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase more cows.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
This lady’s name is Karine and she is 28 years old. With her parents, sister and retired grandmother, she lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Karine graduated Yerevan State Linguistic University and started from 2010 she works at the city school as a teacher of English Language and Literature. Being young, full of energy and useful knowledge, Karine works with great pleasure and her pupils manage to have a lot of success in their studying.

Despite her youth, she is already known in the school as a good specialist and is a greatly respected teacher. She also helps some pupils at her house to prepare their lessons and overcome some hardships that they have in their teaching process.

This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Karine hopes to receive as she greatly wants to buy a computer, accessories for it and also professional literature, as she finds very important self-development for any pedagogue and these are the right tools for this activity.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories for it and also professional literature, as she finds very important her self-development as pedagogue.  She teaches English.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is married with children. She deals in shoes from China. The last loan helped her to buy more shoes for selling. She still faces a challenge of limited capital, seasonal sales and competition from people dealing in similar businesses.

Loice wants to stock better quality shoes for business of both men and women, to be able reduce competition for her business to perform better. She is requesting for a loan to hit the target mentioned above by buying more shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Satik

texts.en:
Satik is 52 years old and she lives with her husband and son in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. She has vocational medical education and many years she worked as a nurse. Now with her husband she is busy with their farming and agriculture. They have rich farm and also a lot of work to do there. Their son works at the city’s police station.

Satik has great request and as well as great hope, that Kiva lenders will help her. She asks this Kiva loan in an amount of 750.000 Armenian drams for needed dental treatment. She thanks beforehand and hopes that thanks to this loan very soon she will get read of the great discomfort that she has to feel every day.

loans.use: for needed dental treatment.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is a married woman and has 1 child. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 3 years.

Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge as having inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to have a bigger business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Sumimie 2 Group

texts.en:
With a heart full of gratitude, the group of Sumimie 2, with Anita as their representative, are seeking a loan in Chorkor in the greater Accra Region of Ghana,

Anita is a married woman with two (2) lovely kids. With the help of Kiva, through ID-Ghana, she and her colleague started a small-scale business that they've been running for some time now. They are involved in the sale of sewing accessories and provisions. With Kiva, they are able to support the growth of the business and regular repayment of loans to ID-Ghana.

With this loan, they will be able to improve and expand the business by yielding a profit boost to properly meet customer needs.

loans.use: to be able to improve and expand the business by yielding a profit boost to properly meet customer needs.

loans.name: Florentine

texts.fr:
Florentine est âgée de 33 ans, elle habite en milieu rural. C’est une femme qui a une volonté d’entreprendre qui veut réussir dans tout ce qu’elle fait. Son mari travaille auprès d’un étranger. Le couple a 4 enfants (13-9-7-5 ans) tous scolarisés. 
Elle a déjà fait de l’élevage de poulets de chair en 2013. Elle a arrêté l’activité en raison du passage d’une maladie qui a frappé le cheptel. Cinq familles pratiquent cet élevage dans le quartier. Actuellement , elle a décidé de reprendre l’activité, plusieurs commandes ont été obtenues des anciens clients. Le recours à un troisième prêt est nécessaire pour la reprise des activités. Le prêt servira à acheter des poussins chair, et de provende pour l’alimentation du cheptel (provendes démarrage, croissance et finition). Le bâtiment d’élevage de poulets de chair est en cours de réhabilitation.
L’objectif est de toujours augmenter l’effectif du cheptel de l’élevage et de monter une grande ferme dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Florentine is thirty three years old, married and lives in the countryside. She is an enterprising woman who wants to succeed in whatever she does. She has four children (thirteen, nine, seven and five years old) who all attend school. Her husband earns a living working for a foreign enterprise.

Back in 2013, Florentine worked raising chickens but stopped this business following disease which hit her flock. Five families work locally in this domain and Florentine has decided to take it up again. She has several orders already from her former customers. In order to finance this new venture, she has requested a third loan to buy new birds and feed. She is currently working to renovate the chicken coop.

Florentine's aim is to increase the size of her flock and run a large farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed for growth and finishing.

loans.name: St. Herman's School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is John Peter. He is the head teacher of St. Hermans Lwankoni School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kalisizo in Masaka with 350 students.

St. Hermans School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

St. Hermans School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. John Peter ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Telma

texts.pt:
Mãe solteira de 33 anos de idade, tem dois filhos, um de 18 e outro de 8 anos, os 2 a estudarem no ensino secundario e primario respectivamente, vive na casa própria, estudou ate 10ª classe, vive a base de negocio que é sua principal fonte de renda e que pratica a mais de 5 anos. Está a repetir o crédito pela terceira vez e com os anteriores sempre investiu na compra e venda de roupas usadas e na renovacao de alguns bens em sua casa.
Com o actual pretende comprar lencois, cortinas, etc, para ampliar o seu negocio.
Seu maior desejo consiste em desenvolver mais o seu negocio e construir uma casa de material convencional.
seu maior desafio e o facto de o negocio as vezes fracassar quando seus clientes não cumprirem com seus pagamentos.
texts.en:
Telma is a single mother who is 33 years old. She has two children, ages 18 and 8, who are in secondary and primary school, respectively. She owns her home and attended school through the 10th grade. She supports herself with her business which is her primary source of income. She has had the business for more than 5 years.

This is her third loan. With the prior loans she always invested in the purchase and sale of used clothing and the repair of some items in her home. With this loan she will purchase sheets, curtains, etc. to expand her business.

Her greatest desire is to develop her business more and to build a home from conventional materials. Her greatest challenge is that her business sometimes fails when her customers don't make their payments.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, curtains, etc, to expand her business.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 28-year-old, married young lady from Jenin City. Her husband works as a simple worker and gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all of the family's needs.

Maha is a student in the local university where she studies Educational methods. She wants to take a BA degree and find a job in the future, to support her family.

She took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay her university fees for the last semester. By taking this loan, Maha will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

She appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay her university fees for the last semester.

loans.name: Aalea

texts.en:
Aalea is 35-year-old woman from Jabalia City. She is married and the mother of two kids.

Aalea was living with her family in a small, humble house, but during the latest war in Gaza, her house was destroyed completely, and she had to rent a small apartment in the same area.

Recently, Aalea took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild her old house. The loan will allow Aalea to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return her family to their normal life.

Aalea appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild her old house.

loans.name: Salimahon

texts.ru: Салимахон 48 летняя бабушка. У нее не большая семья. Салимахон живет вместе с 18 летным сыном. Ее дочка замужем и имеет детей. Салимахон жительница района Бохтар. Она занимается продажей самбусы и пирожки. Салимахон дома печет самбусы и пирожки, потом продает их в небольшой  столовой. Она печет вкусные самбусы. Вот так она зарабатывает на жизнь. Салимахону не хватает денег для мероприятия обрезания внука. И она из-за нехватки денег решила взять кредит и хочет успешно проводить мероприятия обрезания внука. Салимахон надеется на Вас и на Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Salimahon is a 48 years old grandmother. She has a small family. She lives together with her 18 year old son. Her daughter is married and has children. Salimahon is a resident of the Bohtar region.

Salimahon works with selling samosas and pirogi. She bakes them at her home, and then she sells them in a small canteen. She bakes very tasty samosas. This is how she earns a living.

Salimahon does not have enough money to hold a celebration for her grandson's circumcision. And due to the lack of money she decided to take a loan and would like to host such an event successfully. Salimahon depends on you and your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her grandson's circumcision celebration

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is 43-year-old woman from Jabalia City, married and mother to two children. Ahlam was living with her family in a small humble house, but during the latest war on Gaza, her house destroyed completely. She had to rent a small apartment in the same area.

Recently Ahlam took a USD loan from Palestine for credit and Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild her old house. The loan will allow Ahlam to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return her family to their normal life.
Ahlam appears in the photo.

loans.use: in order to rebuild her old house which was destroyed in war.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 41-year-old married woman with two children. Her oldest child is 13 years old while her youngest child is 9 years old.

Lolita has raised pigs for five years to earn a living while her husband financially supports them by driving. She and her husband work together to provide for the needs of their children and to sustain their daily needs.

Aside from raising pigs, Lolita sells food to the community of Mahaplag, Leyte. In the future, she wishes to expand her piggery to become sustainable and profitable. For now, she is in need of a loan to buy feed for her pigs. She will also buy food ingredients such as flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs; and food ingredients such as flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Bibigul

texts.en:
