Bibigul lives with her family in the South part of Tajikistan. She is married and has 4 adult children. Bibigul’s family is large because she has some grandchildren and daughters-in-law. Bibigul works hard for the well-being of her family for the last 13 years. Bibigul grows wheat, maize, tomatoes, water-melon etc. She plants twice in a year. Her husband, sons and daughters-in-law help her on the farm.

Bibigul is going to do a new sowing, but she has not the money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. Bibigul is asking for a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman with five children. She describes herself to be energetic. She operates a tailor shop where she makes clothes, and she has been involved in this business for three years.

Sarah's business is located in a good area and her primary customers are good. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a better business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour ,bread, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, bread, milk, sugar and other items. Her business goal is to open another business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, bread, milk, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 32 years old. She is married and has two children. Her business is farming mangoes and cow peas. She has been in the business for 20 years. She earns a monthly income of eight thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings. She will use the profits from expanded business to expand business and also pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a good family and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is a farmer, and she lives in Kagadi, Uganda. She is 49 years old, and married with 8 children--6 of whom are in school.

Rearing animals and growing crops are Gertrude's major sources of income, which she supplements by weaving baskets and mats. She has been in business since 2008 with an aim of generating income and catering to her family. However, she is always faced with a challenge of bad weather, which destroys her animals and crops.

As a loving mother, she would love to see her children get educated through university. She needs a loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Poghos

texts.en:
Poghos lives with his big family in the Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. He is married and he has two sons and a daughter.

With his beloved wife, Poghos is engaged in farming and he has a rather rich farm with cows, calves, pigs, sheep and chickens. Poghos sells his farm products from his farm since there are a lot people who buy milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, meat and eggs, from his farm in particular, since all of the products are of very good quality.

Poghos also likes his work cultivating land because he manages to have very good potato and tomato products, the sale of which he also manages from his farm.

Poghos mentions that he feels unbelievably happy when he sees how interested his two sons are in farming. They help a lot, working with pleasure and even managing work that is rather hard for them. Poghos is proud that his sons are hard workers who are already significantly involved in farming for their young age.

Now he needs this loan of 700,000 AMD (Armenian drams) for the purchase of one more cow, a calf, and also fodder for his farm cattle, which will bring in more income for his family and it also will help him to prepare a more developed and richer farm for his two future farmers.

loans.use: with the purchase of one more cow, a calf, and also fodder for his farm cattle, which will bring in more income for his family.

loans.name: Alh. Yusuf

texts.en:
Alh. Yusuf is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alh. Yusuf has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alh. Yusuf would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Alh. Yusuf can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alh. Yusuf will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Alh. Yusuf is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
This nice woman’s name is Mareta and she lives with her husband in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Their two sons are already married and they live with their families. Mareta has higher pedagogical education and already 35 years of work experience in that field.

Now also she works at the school as a teacher of Russian Language and Literature. She is a very patient and clever pedagogue who makes her lessons very integrating and informative so her pupils attend her lessons with greatest pleasure. At her house she also gives paid private courses of Russian Language and Literature and helps them to get prepared for the entrance examinations.

Mareta is asking for this Kiva loan of an amount of 500,000 Armenian drams as she wants to buy a computer and also new professional literature as she wants to make her courses more informative and more helpful for her pupils in order easily to overcome their exam hardships.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also new professional literature in order to make her courses more informative and helpful for her pupils.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Samaila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tones of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Samaila can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Samaila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Samaila is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy additional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is 22. A divorced woman, she lives alone and she hasn’t any sons. But she has her own small business.

She is very hardworking, selling clothes and cosmetics in her home, which can provide her a little income.

Tamara wants to improve her house. So she is asking Kiva’s partner ALIBDAA for $1,500 to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, and nails.

She hopes to improve her house in the near future.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, and nails in order to improve her house.

loans.name: Vony

texts.fr:
Vony a 45 ans ; elle est divorcée. Son fils unique de 16 ans suit une formation en comptabilité. Elle a ouvert une petite unité de coiffure il y a maintenant environ une année. C’est un projet qu’elle a souhaité réaliser depuis son enfance. Elle a démarré l’activité par des petits matériels en sa disposition. D’autres investissements ont été réalisés à partir des précédents prêts (3 prêts successifs) . Maintenant que l’activité a bien commencé, elle veut améliorer les services par l’acquisition de matériels adéquats. L’acquisition de stabilisateur est nécessaire afin d’éviter la destruction des matériels par le fréquent  délestage.
L’objectif est que l’unité deviendra un grand salon de coiffure dans la zone, le rêve étant la réussite de son unique enfant dans la vie.
texts.en:
Vony is forty-five years old and divorced. Her only son is sixteen years old and is training to be an accountant. Vony opened a small hairdressing salon one year ago, fulfilling a dream she has had since childhood. She began the business with equipment which she had to hand and then used previous loans (three in total) to make further investments. Now that the business is running well, she would like to purchase more equipment to improve the service she can offer.

Vony would like to run a large salon in her district and ensure the success of her only son.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing products and equipment for the salon.

loans.name: Berta

texts.pt: A Senhora  Albertina  é viuva e mãe de3 filhos,1 é que vai a escola o seu esposo perdeu a vida a 8 anos atrás.Ela ganha uma pensão de sobrevivência mensalmente pois o esposo era um funcionario do estado,o valor que ela ganha é muito pouco para garantir uma boa alimentação e formação academica dos filhos. Esta situação levou com que a Dona Albertina começasse a practicar um pequeno negocio informal  vendendo capulanas e outros vestuarios num regime ambulatorio, assim com o pouco que ganhava pagava a escola dos filhos mas isso não era suficiente para aquilo que era a realidade da situação familiar. Face a esta  situação a dona Albertina mudou de negocio e abrindo um estabelecimento comercial em casa para vender produtos alimentares e foi neste momento que conheceu a Hluvuku,desde ai foi sempre benefeciando se dos emprestimos ,agora é a quinta vez que tem emprestimo da Hluvuku onde com o dinheiro pretende comprar produtos para a mercearia tais como  açucar,arroz,farrinha de milho,batata reno,refrescos,cerveja e cabelos para beleza femenina.O seu maior sonho é continuar a ser cliente da hluvuku e expandir o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Albertina is a widow and mother of 3 children, one who attends school. Her husband died 8 years ago. She receives a widow's pension monthly because her husband was an employee of the state. The amount she receives is too small to guarantee good nutrition and education for her children. This situation led Albertina to start a small informal business selling capulanas (sarongs) and other clothing door to door. With the little she earned she was able to pay for her children's schooling, but this wasn't enough for her family situation.

Facing this situation, Albertina changed businesses and opened a shop to sell groceries, This was also the moment that she learned about Hluvuku. Since them she has always benefited from loans. This is her fifth loan with Hluvuku and with the money she plans to purchase products for her shop such as sugar, rice, corn meal, potatoes, soft drinks, beer, and hair for female beauty needs. Her greatest dream is to continue to be a client of Hluvuku and to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, corn meal, potatoes, soft drinks, beer, and hair for beauty needs.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Илхомчон из района Бохтар. Он один сын и старший в семье. У него есть 4 сестер. Мама и сестричка занимаются торговлей деятельности. Другие домохозяйки.  Илхомчон заботливый и честный брат. Ему 31 лет. У Илхомчон есть свой источник доход. Он занимается торговлей дверей. Илхомчон продает разные двери, и у нее много постоянные клиенты. За счет доход от торговли Илхомчон кормить семью. Он хочет улучшить жилищные условия сестер и матерью, чтобы иметь все удобство и жить комфортно. Илхомчон решил отремонтировать дом. Для совершения данной операции Илхомчону нужны деньги. По этой причине он обратился за кредитом. Поддержите его достичь своих целей. Илхомчон будет рад на Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ilhomjon is from the Bohtar region. He is the eldest child and only son of his family. He has 4 sisters. His mother and little sister work in retail sales. The rest are housewives.

Ilhomjon is a caring and honest brother. He is 31 years old. He has his own source of income; he works with selling doors. Ilhomjon sells different kinds of doors, and he has many returning customers. Ilhomjon feeds his family based on the income from the business.

Ilhomjon would like to improve his sister and mother's living conditions, so they can have all the convenience and live comfortably. He decided to renovate their house. To realize this operation he needs money. For this reason he applied for a loan. Please help him reach his goal. Ilhomjon will be happy for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and renovate his family's house.

loans.name: Rozine

texts.en:
Rozine is a 34-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and her only child. In 2006, she started her own business, by opening her shop for vending toys and accessories with her special selling methods and giving a high quality of products provided. She is well-known in her area with the special talents in her domain.

Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to increase her business merchandise to meet the needs of her clients in order to increase her income. Rozine is very proud of her business growth and she hopes to enlarge her shop in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло проживает в городке Исфара, там же она работает и проводит все свое время. Шахло живет вместе с тремя детьми. Ее муж, как и многие мужчины, работает в Российской Федерации. Шахло занимается продажей женского белья. Доход от этого бизнеса многозначительна для ее семьи, так как экономическая ситуация в России очень влияет на заработок мигрантов и не всегда ее муж имеет возможности отправлять деньги семье. Шахло решила привести зимнюю одежду на продажу и просит помочь ей в этом. Она надеется, что таким образом немножко увеличить доход и улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Shahlo lives in the city of Isfara. She also works and spends her time there. Shahlo lives together with her three children. Her husband, like many other men, works in the Russian Federation.

Shahlo works with selling women's lingerie. The income is very meaningful for her family, as the economic situation in Russia really affects the earnings of migrant workers and her husband does not always have an opportunity to send money to the family.

Shahlo decided to bring in winter clothing for selling, and requests you to help her with this. She hopes that she can increase her income a little this way, and improve the family's financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing for selling

loans.name: Mbigo

texts.en:
Mbigo is a married man with six children. He describes himself to be risk-taker. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, rice, sugar, sweets and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years.

Mbigo's business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread, soap and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread, soap and other items.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be persistent. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be the leading wholesaler. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Vivian works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Vivian is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy additional materials and tools for her fishing business.

Vivian has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha a married woman with five children. She used the previous loan to buy wraps for women to sell.

She operates a boutique in a busy market and has been in business for close to ten years. By doing this she is able to meet her family's needs.

Aisha would love to add more stock, specifically wraps for women called "bitenge", because they are easily bought in that area. But she does not have enough money. She requests another loan to buy more bitenge to sell and improve her income levels.

loans.use: to buy more wraps for women (called "bitenge") to sell

loans.name: Margareth Esther

texts.es:
Margareth es una mujer de buenas ideas y de mente creativa, siempre está tratando de buscar actividades para aumentar sus ingresos familiares.

Ella monto un café internet desde hace 3 y vende alternativamente algunos elementos de papelería en el mismo negocio.

Ella tiene 28 años y tiene todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar los desafíos que la vida le tenga preparados.

Ella solicita un apoyo económico para comprar una carpa que le permita refrescar el local y protegerlo de la intemperie. Con este dinero podrá invertir en su negocio y atraerá más clientes impactando de esta manera sus utilidades de una manera positiva.

Su mayor sueño es tener una gran sala de internet con buenos ingresos y generar empleo.
texts.en:
Margareth is a woman with a creative mind and good ideas. She is always searching for activities to increase her family's income.

She opened an internet café, from which she also sells paper products. She is 28 years old and has everything she needs to confront the challenges life has in store for her.

Margareth is requesting this economic support in order to buy a tent that would allow her to freshen up her store and protect it from the outdoor elements. With this money, she will be able to invest in her business, attract more customers, and positively impact her profits.

Her biggest dream is to have a great internet cafe with good income and to generate employment.

loans.use: to buy a tent that would allow her to freshen up her shop and protect it from the outdoor elements.

loans.name: Matia

texts.en:
Matia lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He is 26 years old, and married with 3 children. He has operated a general merchandise retail shop since 2008. As his major source of income, he put this business in place to create employment for himself.

Matia has a dream of prospering economically, however, his major challenge is that of competition and defaulting customers. He now needs a loan to buy more clothes for selling in order to increase the stock for his business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling

loans.name: Jeton

texts.en:
Jeton is a return and loyal client, having already borrowed from Kiva twice before. He has always appreciated the help from Kiva and been satisfied with the loan process and results.

Now, for a third time, he is requesting a loan for his same business, operating his car wash. He is in need of a new electrical machine and some other tools for his work and promises to pay on time as usual. As a client in good standing, he hopes to be able to continue receiving the assistance to be able to continue his business and eventually expand it in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new electrical machine for his car wash business and some other tools.

loans.name: Sithan's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district, Sithan is 41-year-old and a mother of a child who is in school. The main source of her family’s income is from weaving cotton scarves for sale. She has been doing this for about 21 years and also works for others for a fee to get additional income to improve her living.

Her business is not growing so well which enables her to earn less income than before. After successfully repaying both the past two loans, she is applying for a new loan with VisionFund.

For this new loan, she forms as a group of three and she is going to manage her entire loan portion to buy needed materials to make more cotton scarves and pay for labor fees to support her business. She hopes to sell it for good profit so as to upgrade her family conditions.

loans.use: to buy needed weaving materials to make more cotton scarves, so that she can increase sales as well as her profits.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Na Tau 23 Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chinh is a Thai ethnic man who is 38 years old, married and has two children. He lives with his parents, his wife, his younger sister and his children in an old Thai ethnic traditional house in a remote village where people mainly rely on agriculture to earn a living. Like other villagers, Mr. Chinh works very hard at cultivation and animal husbandry to provide for his crowded family with plenty of activities such as growing rice, corn, cassava, raising buffalo, pigs, chicken, ducks and fish.

This is the second time that Mr. Chinh has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and he will use the loan to buy baby fish to develop fish farming. With good experience in farming and along with the technical support of the Program including training and counseling in agriculture, he believes that his investment will reap good profit, then he can gradually improve income for his family.

Mr. Chinh dreams that his family will always be happy together like this with a more abundant life and he wants his children to be successful in the future. In the picture, he stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy baby fish to develop fish farming.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Racheal. She is thirty seven years old and blessed with seven children. She earns a living by selling timber and firewood.

She is happy for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa enterprise training she received which equipped her with skills to manage her business well. High demand in the market has made her apply for a loan to boost her business by adding more stock, thus allowing her to earn more income. This will enable her to meet her family's needs, including food, clothing and payment of school fees for her kids.

Racheal is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood and timber to boost her income.

loans.name: Kafo Group

texts.fr:
ZOUMANA est le monsieur qui tient la scie en main sur la photo. C’est un forgeron Malien, âgé de 58 ans. Il est marié et père de 6 enfants âgés de 20 à 4 ans, tous scolarisés. Sa femme est une ménagère.
ZOUMANA achète des matières premières (bois et fer) dans le marché rural et vend ses produits finis (charrette, charrue…) dans les marchés environnants. Le profit qu’il réalise lui permet de prendre en charges certaines dépenses  de sa famille. Il emprunte de l’argent avec le RMCR pour accroitre sa capacité de production de chattes, charrues …N’ayant pas été à l’école, il a une expérience de plus de trente (30) ans dans son activité, et se sent à l’aise dans l’exercice de ce métier dont il a appris depuis l’enfance. ZOUMANA est très souvent confronté aux problèmes de fonds pour accroitre son activité. Son rêve est de pouvoir ouvrir un centre de métier dans sa localité afin de contribuer d’avantage au développement économique de la communauté.
texts.en:
Zoumana is seen in the photo holding a saw. He is a Malian blacksmith and is fifty-eight years old. Zoumana is married and father to six children aged from four to twenty years old, all of his children have attended school. His wife looks after the household.

Zoumana buys raw materials (wood and iron) from rural markets and then sells his products (carts and ploughs) in local markets. His profits enable him to provide for his family. He is requesting this loan from the field partner RMCR, to increase his production capacity. He never attended school but has more than thirty years experience in his trade. His main problem is lack of funds to finance his business.

Zoumana's dream is to open a workshop in his neighbourhood to contribute to the economic development of his community.

loans.use: to build carts and ploughs for sale.

loans.name: Fotimajon

texts.ru: Фотимачон благодарна за первый кредит. Она верила, что ее обязательно услышат и могут помочь, с большой уверенностью и надеждой в глазах она вновь обращается за займом. Фотимачон решила привести новый товар и обновить продукцию в магазине. Для совершения этой операции она просит помочь Вас поучаствовать. Фотимачон привезет новые ковры и станет еще счастливее.
texts.en:
Fotimajon is thankful for her first loan. She believed that she was heard, and that you can definitely help her. With great confidence and hope in her eyes she applied for a loan again.

Fotimajon decided to bring in new goods and renew the products in her store. To realize this operation she requests you to participate and help her. Fotimajon will bring in new carpets and will be even happier.

loans.use: to purchase carpets and renew the products in her store

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро очень рада, что есть люди, которые ее паддерживают. Она благодарить Вас на Вашу доброту. Зухро много лет занимается шитьем женской одежды. До сегодняшнего дня Зухро продвигает свое любимое дело. У нее клиенты постоянно возрастаю, потому что шьет красиво и быстро. Зухро надо оплатить за следующего года обучения сына. Но у Зухро нет такая сумма денег, и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Зухро верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Zuhro is very happy that there are people who support her. She is thankful to you and for your kindness. Zuhro has worked with sewing women's clothing for many years. She continues this, her favorite activity, to this day. The number of customers is constantly increasing because she sews beautifully and fast.

Zuhro needs to pay for her son's tuition for next year. however she does not have this sum of money, and for this reason she applied for a loan. Zuhro trusts in you and your support.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition for next year

loans.name: Mercideta

texts.en:
Mercideta is a sari-sari store (general store) owner. She lives a simple life with her family in a town of Mahaplag, Leyte. She is married and blessed with a 10-year-old son. Her husband provides for the needs of their family through farming. Mercideta wishes to be a good mother to her son and a good wife to her husband, by giving a quality education to her child and financial support to her husband.

She is asking for a loan to improve their sari-sari store and to enhance their farming system. She plans to buy grocery items for the store such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, sugar, powdered milk, coffee, chips, biscuits, chocolate bars, candies, bread, powdered juice, and soft drinks.

In the future, Mercideta wishes to improve and expand her business to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, sugar, powdered milk, coffee, chips, biscuits, chocolate bars, candies, bread, powdered juice, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, rice, tomatoes, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, sugar, flour, tomatoes and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, the business will grow. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a motorcycle to supply goods to villages.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, sugar, flour, tomatoes and other items

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman, and has 6 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals, which she has been involved with for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regulars.

She describes her biggest business challenge as drought, which affects the supply of cereals. She will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more cereals. Her business goal is to have the best business within 5 years.

She hopes that in the future, she will raise the living standards of her family. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the 30,000 KES loan to service and maintain his motorcycle. His business goal is to have a taxi business within five years. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
Rodita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rodita is 58 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rodita has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Rodita requested a PHP 30000 loan amount through NWTF to buy nipa leaves, bamboo stick, and other supplies .

Rodita has been in this business for 37 years. In the future, Rodita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy nipa leaves, bamboo stick, and other supplies

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 44 years old and she lives with her husband in Sevan City in Gegharkunik region. Anahit is a housewife and her husband has a small, seasonal business. They both also take care of their farm. They have two nice daughters, both of whom are students.

Anahit rents a flat in Yerevan; they live there because their elder daughter studies at the Yerevan State Linguistic University and her youngest daughter studies at the Yerevan State Economical Institute. They are very clever and hardworking students and both have achieved good grades. The hardship is their tuition fees, since both girls are studying in the paid divisions of their schools.

Anahit will be incredibly thankful if Kiva lenders help her to solve this problem, with this loan of 430,000 AMD (Armenian drams). She will divide this loan equally and pay for her daughters’ tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay for her daughters’ tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Sadress

texts.en:
Sadress is a mother of four children and their sole provider. She operates a bar business, owns rentals, earns salary, and also does agriculture to get income to look after her children. By doing all these she provides for her children. Her greatest desire is to educate her children to higher levels of learning, having a desire of improving her bar, by buying a refrigerator, plastic chairs and more drinks.

This is because she wants to modernize her bar and serve her customers well with their demands for cold drinks. The challenge is she has less money to buy all the required items for her bar. She is requesting for money to meet her budget of buying a refrigerator, plastic chairs and more drinks to sell in her bar.

loans.use: to buy  a refrigerator, plastic chairs and more drinks to use in her bar.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is a 50-year-old mother living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. She owns a women's salon where she offers hair dressing, braids and weaves. She started this business to supplement her husband's income to meet the family's needs, including paying school fees for children in high levels of education.

Her business is doing well now, after seven years, but it lacks modernization needed to overcome the high competition. Such modernization would require a small amount of capital. Therefore, Jemimah is requesting a loan to buy braids and weaves for hair dressing.

loans.use: to buy braids and weaves for hair dressing.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is thirty one years old and married, with 3 children who attend school in Kasese district. She operates a cosmetics shop which is her main source of income.

The last time she took out a loan, she used it to buy cosmetics to sell. With the proceeds, she was able to save, pay medical bills, and reinvest in the business.

She works hard, with a dream of expanding her business. Mary has thought of better ways to get more income and attract customers. This includes stocking international hair chemicals and cosmetics in her shop. The challenge is, the money at hand is not enough. Mary wants money to buy the latest cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy the latest cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Angie Paola

texts.es:
Angie, a sus 18 años de edad, es una mujer carismática, activa y servicial. Su familia es el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y salir adelante. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 4 años, comenzó a comercializar productos de uso personal a través de catálogo, de muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector y lograr una buena trayectoria. 

Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará desodorantes, cremas, lociones, maquillaje, entre otros, al por mayor y así podrá satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en esta temporada navideña, esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Angie manifiesta que nada le impide hacer lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en una gran distribuidora de mercancía y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar tanto de su familia, como la de aquellas personas que le ayuden a realizar su labor diaria.

Anímate a prestar al negocio de Angie!
texts.en:
Angie, at 18 years old, is a charismatic, active, and attentive woman. Her family is her main reason for fighting tirelessly day in and day out, searching for opportunities to earn a living and get ahead in life. Four years ago she started to sell personal use products of high quality and excellent prices through a catalog, which allowed her to make herself known in the sector and achieve a good record.

This propelled her to request the help of a loan in order to strengthen her inventory because she will buy deodorants, creams, lotions, and makeup, among other items at wholesale price. Thus she will be able to satisfy the demand that increases in the Christmas season, and this will help her to improve the income that she earns from her work.

Angie says that nothing prevents her from doing what excites her; for this reason she always proposes new goals, and among them is to become a great supplier of merchandise and to generate employment opportunities so she can improve the quality of life and well-being of much of her family, as that of those who help her carry out her daily work.

Come on and lend to Angie's business!

loans.use: to strengthen her inventory because she will buy deodorants, creams, lotions, and makeup, among other items.

loans.name: Saroeurn's Group

texts.en: Originally from Kandal province, Saroeurn, 33, is a mother of three children who are in school. To make a living, she has been working at garment factory for 13 years and she can earn additional income via growing rice to upgrade her family conditions.  Due to lack of water, she couldn’t grow her rice well and this is the main challenge for her rice farming. For Saroeurn, she has never been with VisionFund to get a loan to support her business. As a group leader of four members, she will manage her entire portion of loan to buy organic fertilizer for farmland, which is expected to increase crop yields. She hopes to get more income to improve her living standard and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to increase crop yields so as to improve living condition and keep her children in school. .

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Naomi. She is thirty four years old, a single mother of two children. She joined hand in hand eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014 and has undergone training on enterprise development and financial management.

She runs a green grocery kiosk to earn a living. She is borrowing to be able to sell more kale, onions and tomatoes to boost sales. This will lead to more income thus a better life. She will be in a position to pay school fees for her children without difficulties.
Naomi is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promise to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more kales, onions and tomatoes to boost sales. This will lead to more income thus a better life.

loans.name: Yolande Volahanta Marie Lovasoa

texts.fr:
Yolande a 42 ans, et est mariée. Le couple a quatre (16-14-11-3 ans) dont trois scolarisés. Son conjoint l’aide également dans cette activité. L’activité est la principale source de revenu du ménage.
Elle dispose 14 années d’expérience dans la boucherie. Les produits achetés sont vendus au marché du District où elle dispose d’un pavillon. C’est une activité héritée de ses parents. Le problème du secteur est la hausse du prix à l’approvisionnement et il faut vendre beaucoup plus en quantité si on veut en tirer des bénéfices suffisants. Les prêts obtenus (2 prêts successifs)  ont tous été utilisés à l‘augmentation du fonds de roulement. La réussite de l’activité de boucherie dépend du montant du fonds utilisé à l’achat de viande.
Le rêve du couple étant de pouvoir offrir à ses enfants des meilleures conditions de vie et construction de maison.
texts.en:
Yolande is forty-two years old and married. She has four children (sixteen, fourteen, eleven and three years old), of whom three attend school. Her husband works with her in their business and this is how the household earns a living. Yolande has fourteen years experience working as a butcher, and learnt her trade from her parents. They sell their meat from a stand at the district market.

The main problem with the business is the increase in price of raw materials and the need to sell more and more in order to earn sufficient. The previous loans (two in total) have been used to increase the working capital of the business. This is vital to ensure success.

The couple dream of being able to offer their children a better standard of living and being able to build their own home.

loans.use: to buy different types of meat.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is a 46 year old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and one brother. In 2008, she started running her own shop selling flowers. Her income is important to help with the family expenses. She has a wide variety of flowers and decoration accessories. Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to expand her store’s inventory of flowers and to buy an air conditioning unit. Her intention at this stage is to augment her sales to increase her income. In the future, she is planning to enlarge her business and collect higher revenues

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory of flowers and to buy an air conditioning

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to expand the business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will support her family with proceeds from the business.

This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a married woman. She has 9 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells books, pens and other stationery. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of books, pens, pencils. Her business goal is to expand the business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will support her family with proceeds from the business.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of books, pens, pencils.

loans.name: Netchel

texts.en:
Netchel is a 29-year-old woman from Mahaplag, Leyte. She is a mother of two children aged 6 and 4 years old. She earns a living through buying and selling dry goods such as RTW (ready to wear) products, beauty products and cosmetics. She has been doing this business for nine years.

Netchel wants to have a sustainable livelihood for the future of her children. With this, she wishes to borrow money to have additional capital to buy beauty products like lotion, cream, powder, make-up and fragrances. She will also buy RTW products such as shirts, underwear, slippers, sandals and bags. In the future, she wishes to start a sari-sari store (variety) business to enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy beauty products like lotion, cream, powder, make-up and fragrances, shirts, underwear, slippers, sandals and bags.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nelida is 41 years old now.

Nelida has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Nelida requested a PHP 30000 loan amount through NWTF to buy nipa leaves, bamboo stick, etc..

Nelida has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Nelida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy nipa leaves, bamboo stick, etc.

loans.name: Furaha Tuendelee Group

texts.fr: Bibisire est commerçante, présidente du groupe de crédits «Furaha Tuendelee», cliente de l’IMF Hekima,  divorcée, âgée de 48 ans, mère de 4 enfants dont 3 étudient et 1 est petit. Elle est propriétaire d’un magasin et vendeuse des souliers en plastic dans la ville depuis 12 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 100 paires de souliers. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son petit ami. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Bibisire is a trader and president of the loan group 'Furaha Tuendelee', a client of the field partner, Hekima. She is forty-eight years old, divorced and mother to four children, three of whom attend school and one of whom is too young.

Bibisire has owned and run a shop in town, selling plastic shoes, for twelve years. She will use this loan to buy one hundred pairs of shoes for sale. She began her business with funds from her boyfriend. Her aim is to increase her working capital, feed and educate her children. She is grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 100 pairs of shoes for sale.

loans.name: Artush

texts.en:
Artush is 49 years old and he lives in Lchashen village in Gegharkunik region. Artush is a farmer and the only bread-winner in his house.

On the farm, he has cows, calves, heifers, bulls, pigs, sheep and chickens. He does his best to organize profitable sale of his farm products such as milk, cheese, butter, curd, meat and eggs.

He sells this nice and testy assortment to his regular customers from his village. He also gathers harvest of potatoes, cucumbers, greens and peppers from his land and takes them to the city’s wholesale market for sale.

Artush mentions that all his great efforts and his day and night work are for securing better living conditions for his children and as well as fewer financial hardships and problems. Now he seeks this loan because he wants to buy potato seedlings and fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings as well as fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Tous Unis Group

texts.fr: Lutonde est commerçante, trésorière de la banque communautaire «Tous unis», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 35 ans, mère de 7 enfants dont 6 scolarisés et 1 est gosse. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans un dépôt de la gallérie de la ville depuis 9 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en cinquante sacs de riz. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Lutonde is a trader and treasurer of the loan group 'Tous unis', a client of the field partner, Hekima. She is thirty-five years old, married and mother to seven children, six of whom attend school and one of whom is too young.

Lutonde has been selling basic foodstuffs from her shop in a shopping centre for nine years. She will use this loan to buy fifty sacks of rice. She began her business with funds from her husband. Her aim is to build a house, feed and educate her children. She is grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy fifty sacks of rice.

loans.name: Rahat

texts.en:
59 year old Rahat is a widow with one child. To provide her child and the local children with a quality education, she opened a school five years ago and runs it herself.

Rahat has borrowed PKR 60,000 in order to expand her school's facilities and provide more space and furniture for her students. In the future she hopes to keep providing her students with more tools so they can attend secondary school and university.

loans.use: to expand her school's facilities and provide more space and furniture for her students.

loans.name: Upendo Wa Akina Mama Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Felista; she is married and blessed with five children. She is a member of Upendo wa AKina Mama Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH-EA) in 2014 and has been trained on enterprise and financial management.
Felista operates a general kiosk, greengrocer store and also does mixed farming. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy more vegetables and flour to boost her businesses by improving sales. She anticipates for more profits that will enable her pay school fees and provide better diet to her family.
She thanks Kiva and their lenders for the assistance and promise to pay on time.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and flour to boost her businesses.

loans.name: Garba

texts.en:
Garba is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Garba is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tones of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Garba would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Garba will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Garba now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Omorde Bor Group

texts.en:
For the well-being of their business development, Omorde Bor Group at Chorkor village in the greater Accra region of Ghana wishes to seek the help of Kiva through ID-Ghana by means of financial assistance.

Isaka is a woman of a humble beginnings, fighting so hard to serve the regular needs of her customers. She and her colleague sell charcoal, and due to their loyal attitude and regular repayment of her loans, she will be very much grateful if their needs are met.

She is married with three children who are students.

loans.use: to serve the regular needs of her customers and expand her charcoal business.

loans.name: Farruh

texts.en:
Farruh is young and clever boy. He is single and lives with his family. The family consists of 5 members. He is a student in Law at the 3rd course State University of Tajikistan.

Farruh dreams to be a good lawyer in future and work in any organization. He is asking for a loan to pay for the university tuition because his parents have no money to pay for it. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition leading to a degree in Law

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 42-year-old, Lebanese married woman and mother of three children. Her husband is the main source of income to provide for their life requirements. She is very tender and cares a lot about all of her family members.

Today, she is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to pay her children’s educational fees. She tends to help them and to provide them with a good education. This is her first loan and she wants to express her thanks for it.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Thủy And Friends Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thuỷ is 30 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture raising cattle for 7 years. Thuỷ lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The income from this business is unstable because when some disease of cattle happens, they could die, which left her nothing to sell. And she will be in financial trouble.

The main hardship that Thuỷ faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. This is Thuỷ first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could improve her living standard.

She is the group leader of "Thủy and friends", which consists of three members. In the future, Thuỷ hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells cashewnuts. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be seasonality of cashew nuts. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of cashew nuts. She hopes that in the future, she will excel. She will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a married man. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells basins, fruits and other plastic containers. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good place and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 120,000 loan to buy more stock of plastic containers and other items. His business goal is to be a supplier to other retailers within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of plastic containers.

loans.name: Zhora

texts.en:
Zhora is 68 years old and he lives in the village of Yegheg in Syunik region. Zhora is married and he has three daughters and two sons. All of his children are already married and they live separately with their families.

Zhora used to work at different organizations and workshops, but now his only and very beloved occupation is farming. Zhora also is a very famous bee keeper and he manages to produce a very tasty honey of perfect quality.

Zhora’s wife is unemployed. She has had some health problems and she had to undergo surgery. Now this loan of 200,000 AMD (Armenian drams) will help him pay for his wife to undergo a course of treatment.

loans.use: to pay for his wife to undergo a course of medical treatment.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married woman. She has 8 children. She describes herself as God-fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells plastic containers, utensils, paper bags and other items. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of plastic containers, utensils and other items. Her business goal is to have a good business within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to build a business store.

loans.use: to buy more stock of plastic containers, utensils and other items.

loans.name: Khayzaran

texts.en:
Khayzaran is a married woman with five children. She is 44 years old and lives in Baqaa. She is ‎conservative woman and asked her son Mamoon to take her place in the photo.

‎Mamoon is one of her children who is 23 years old and studying accounting. He is studying ‎this major because he feels that it will help him to show his creativity and ideas. ‎

Khayzaran feels that her son Mamoon will be someone important in the future; and she ‎cannot wait to see him in the graduation dress. ‎Because of the financial crises that Khayzaran and her husband have been faced with, she asked ‎for an education loan to pay his semester fees and to buy the books he needs.

loans.use: to pay her son's semester fees and to buy the books he needs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is requesting a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business. She is selling gasoline because she earning a good income from this business and she lives near the main road and every day many people come to buy her gasoline so she still happy to do her business.

Maria has been involved in business activities for a few years and she started with her own working capital of $150.00. When Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan for her, she said with this loan she will to improve her management for her business to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional gasoline for sale

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Chanthou is 26 years old who has a small child living in Dambae district of Tbaung Khmum province. To make a living, she has been growing rice for 2 years. Weed has grown rapidly in her farm which is the primary obstacle for her farming business. Her rice did not grow well so she couldn’t get good yields as before. After expenses, she is able to save around 5USD each day.

Chanthou has been with VisionFund for two cycles already and she paid back her past loans successfully. The previous loans helped her to have enough consumption for her family’s living. She leads a group of two to buy fertilizer and pesticide to increase the productivity of crop for supporting her farmland. She hopes this new loan will help her to get higher yields so that she can earn more income to renovate her old house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to increase the productivity of crop, which enable her to earn more income to save for future need.

loans.name: Munatah

texts.en:
Munatah is 39 years old, a married woman and mother of three children. She is a very ‎ambitious woman and she is challenging all obstacles in her life. ‎

Munata got married early and she could not complete her education, but she did not ‎give up her dream which is complete her education and find a good job to be ‎a productive woman. ‎

Now Muntaha is a university student majoring in management information systems. Her ‎husband is facing a financial crises and could not pay for her university therefore she ‎decided to apply for an educational loan to pay for her university fees.‎

loans.use: to pay for her university fees.‎

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
Alhaji Auwalu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Auwalu is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone.

As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Alhaji Auwalu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Auwalu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season, when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Alhaji Auwalu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members, and he would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone.

As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tones of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Yakubu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is 32 years old and has been involved in the running of a small school for the past 17 years. Today there are 300 students in her school, 60% of which are female. Sadia aspires to contribute to the literacy rate of her community, where the majority of parents are illiterate.

"I want to make education affordable for both girls and boys," says Sadia. "My parents found it difficult to provide for me and pay for my education but I feel proud to be contributing towards changing that."

Sadia wants to renovate her school to make it safer and more comfortable for her students. For this purpose she requires a loan worth Rs 200,000 (PKR).

loans.use: to renovate her school to make it safer and more comfortable for her students.

loans.name: Noong Luong 35 Group

texts.en:
Dung, 32, is Thai ethnic woman who has been married and become the mother of two small children. She lives with her husband and her children in a traditional Thai ethnic house.

Her family has encountered plenty of difficulties in life, especially her first-born child who a congenital disability which has made him unable to move or use his hands, and he cannot attend school even though he desires to study.

Dung and her husband have to work so hard to provide for the children, as well as to overcome the difficulty of the handicap situation of their first child. Due to the lack of training and education, they mainly work in agricultural production for a living. They grow rice, breed chicken, duck, musk duck and fish.

Due to the instability of the income from agricultural activities, Dung has always wanted to expand their farming and breeding. This is the third time that she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy baby fish and develop fish farming.

She hopes that her investment will bring in a good income for her family so that she can better provide for her children. Dung dreams that her first-born child's disease will be cured someday so that he can walk, study at school and realize his dream.

In the picture, she is the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy baby fish and develop fish farming

loans.name: Akouyo

texts.fr: Agée de 30 ans, Akouyo est une femme mariée qui vit à Agoè avec trois enfants àcharge. Akouyo est une marchande  de savons de toilette et des détergents. Akouyo s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché  et le revend de quartier en quartier. Akouyo sollicite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de savons et des sacs de détergents. Avec les bénéfices qui en résulteront d’une bonne vente, Akouyo compte appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants et les besoins en  nourriture et santé de la famille.
texts.en:
Akouyo is thirty years old, married and has three children in her care. She lives in Agoè and sells toilet soap and detergent. She buys her supplies three times a month from the market and sells them on foot in her local area.

Akouyo is requesting this loan to buy dozens of soaps and sacks of detergent. Her resulting profits will support her husband in providing for the expenses of their children and the food and healthcare needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy four dozen soaps and three sacks of detergent.

loans.name: Tunda La Roho Group

texts.en:
Sophia is a mother of two children, ages 12 and 9 years old. She and her family live in the eastern part of the city of Uvira in the Democratic Republic of Congo, Her husband is a driver, while Sophia is running a small store business to earn a living.

Sophia has been doing this for almost 6 years. She is asking for a loan to help them enhance their livelihood by buying additional stocks for her small store business, such as biscuits, bread, chips, candies, chocolate bars, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered juice, soft drinks, noodles, and canned goods.

In the future, Sophia dreams of being successful in her business and of having enough money to provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Grace; she is fifty eight years old, married and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 and has undergone training on enterprise and financial management.
She does vegetable farming to earn a living. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy irrigation pipes to boost her farming activities. She hopes her yield will increase and she will be able to afford better diet and shelter.
Grace is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy irrigation pipes to boost her farming activities.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells soap, flour, bread, sugar and other items. Her business is located in a highly populated place and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items

loans.name: Alexina

texts.en:
Alexina is a single woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are regular.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of firewood. Her business goal is to have a timber yard within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have increased income.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 37-year-old married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and their two children who are still studying. Her husband seeks to manage her family’s affairs and to cover their daily needs.

With the requested loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., she would like to pay her children’s educational fees. One of her greatest dreams is to save enough money to provide her children with anything that they need.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Shida

texts.en:
Shida is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be energetic. She operates a retail business where she sells goats. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are regular.

Shida describes her biggest business challenge to be the dry season, which affects feed supply. She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more goats. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better business.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Protus

texts.en:
Protus is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good place and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. He hopes that in the future, he will have a full store. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize.

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
Alhaji is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Alhaji would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Alhaji now has the opportunity to realize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members, and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 36 years old and runs a low-cost private school. Currently there are 86 students in her school, 53% of which are female. Zahida has been running this school for more than a decade but has met with numerous challenges throughout this time period. Lack of finances and the inability to develop her teacher's capacity have been among the most prominent challenges.

Zahida has requested a loan worth Rs 100,000 (PKR) for the purpose of construction and renovation of the school. She believes that students must be provided with a pleasant environment to promote learning. For the past 3 years she has been planning to improve the overall infrastructure of the school, but she has not been able to carry out this plan due to a lack of funds. Zahida aspires to take her school forward by focusing on learning outcomes in the future.

loans.use: to pay for construction and renovation of her school.

loans.name: Bergita

texts.en: Bergita lives in Oecusse, She has been doing business since 2000 with her own working capital of $ 400.00. She is requesting a loan of $ 600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital to buy more additional supplies to keep in her stall, coffee, sugar, candles, salt, biscuits, noodles, aqua and other things to sell.  She is taking this loan to improve her management for her business.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar candles, salt, biscuits, noodles and aqua.

loans.name: Myasar

texts.en:
Myasar is 42. She lives in Dairalla and is a caring mother of three children, Myasar, as all mothers, ‎wants to provide good life for her children. Because of that she decided to help her husband ‎in the household expenses and she started sell blankets in her home. ‎

Because of the high standards of living nowadays, she applied for a loan to help her buy ‎more blankets to sell to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more blankets to sell.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman. She describes herself as innovative. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a tailoring firm within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Bature

texts.en:
Bature is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Bature has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Bature would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Bature can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Bature will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Bature is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en:
Nuhu is a Babban Gona farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Nuhu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan, Nuhu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, he has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Nuhu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to feed his family and children and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Roweida

texts.en: Roweida is a 54-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and two children. Her husband owns a grocery store, and she produces homemade food to help him financially, to be able to enhance their way of living. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children's educational fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as being determined. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes, and he has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in an area with potential for growth and his primary customers are regulars.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. He hopes that in the future, he will have an increased income. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and the previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a widowed woman, with 3 children. She describes herself as being trustworthy. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are regulars.

Gladys describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to expand the business within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is a single man living in a sector in Jordan called Ramtha. He is studying to get his ‎bachelor degree in physical education, and he is now in his third year. The income that ‎comes from his father’s job is income for his family that consists of five members. ‎Recently his father is facing some problems that lead Hani to apply for an educational ‎loan to help him cover his semester fees. Hani`s future plan is to work in the same field.‎

loans.use: cover his semester fees.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
Saúl con 35 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge e hijos, en el distrito de Lagunas,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y ganadería.

Saúl se dedica a prestar servicio como jornalero agrícola por zona de residencia, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 10 años.Además cuenta con ganado lechero. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y comida para estos. De esta manera le facilitará seguir trabajando y seguir obteniendo mejores ingresos.

Saúl no cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Saúl, 35 years old, is in a common law marriage and lives with his wife and children in the Lagunas district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, in the country of Perú. The residents of this town work mostly in agriculture and livestock.

Saúl works as an agricultural day laborer in his zone of residence, with over 10 years of experience in the field. He also has dairy cattle. He requests a loan to buy animals and feed for them. In this way, he will be able to continue working and continue obtaining better income.

Saúl does not have loan experience. He is a new member for Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed.

loans.name: Matumaini Group

texts.en:
Yvoni is 34 years old and living in the Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo in the city of Uvira. She is responsible and committed to her work and her family. She is the mother of three beautiful girls who are 11, 8, and 4 years old.

She alternates between her work selling food with her role as a mother and homemaker. She prepares the foods in her home and sells flour and sugar. She chose to work in order to help her husband with the household expenses.

She uses her earnings from her work for her daughters, so she can see them fulfill their dreams by studying. To see them happy is the most wonderful thing to her. This motivates her to grow and be a better businesswoman.

Yvoni wants to request a loan, which she will use to purchase more flour and sugar to resell. She hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and flour.

loans.name: Alhaji Isuhu

texts.en:
Alhaji Isuhu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Isuhu is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone.

As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Alhaji Isuhu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs.
