With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Isuhu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season, when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Alhaji Isuhu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members, and he would like to use this additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jose Edgardo

texts.es:
Edgardo, de 45 años de edad, es un veterano del ejercito militar salvadoreño retirado, está acompañado, vive con su esposa y tienen tres hijos que asisten a la escuela.

Edgardo, se desempeño como soldado en el ejercito durante el conflicto armado en El Salvador, pero ya está retirado y ahora se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a sembrar maíz y frijol y también se dedica al comercio de cerdos. 

Edgardo, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para sembrar una parcela de cultivos junto a sus compañeros veteranos y así trabajar entre todos para solventar sus necesidades. 

Los sueños de Edgardo son, poder organizarse mejor y en un futuro formar una cooperativa para brindar más apoyo a las personas de bajos recursos.
texts.en:
Edgardo is a 45-year-old retired veteran of the army of El Salvador. He is married, and lives with his wife and his three children, who attend school.

Edgardo was a soldier during the armed conflict in El Salvador, but is now retired and works in agriculture. Specifically, he grows corn and beans, and also sells pigs.

Edgardo needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides, in order to plant a field of crops along with other veterans and thereby work together to meet their needs.

Edgardo's dreams are to be better organized, and in future to form a co-operative to provide more support for people with few resources.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides, in order to plant a field of crops.

loans.name: Amale

texts.en: Amale is a 33-year-old married woman and mother of two children, one of them is still attending school. Her husband represents the main source of income for the family. He works as an employee and also works as a DJ for additional income. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to register her child in school. This is her second loan, but she said that she will be a permanent client and eager to borrow additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to register her child in the school

loans.name: Karina Ester

texts.es:
Un almacén de venta de artículos varios es lo que mantiene viva la ilusión de Karina, ya que su sueño es salir adelante, mejorar su situación económica y sostener a su familia, pues considera que lo más importante en la vida es el trabajo duro y la perseverancia.
Trabaja incansablemente todos durante 15 horas para generar su propio sustento. 

Ella nunca pensó en que podía crecer y ahora que interactuar le da la oportunidad de prestarle dinero, quiere aprovechar para realizar la compra de surtido para su negocio como elementos para el hogar y para el cuidado personal.
texts.en:
A store selling various items is what maintains Karina's hope. Her dream is to get ahead in life, to improve her financial situation, and to provide for her family because she believes the most important thing in life is hard work and perseverance. She works tirelessly 15 hours a day in order to generate her own means of living.

She never thought that she could grow, but now that Interactuar is giving her the opportunity to borrow money she wants to take advantage of it in order to purchase stock for her business, like items for the home and for personal care.

loans.use: to buy stock for her business, like items for the home and for personal care.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man. He has 10 children. He describes himself as humble. He operates a retail business where he sells dried fish (omena type). He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good place and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Fresno desde donde se desempeña en la venta de dulces y frituras.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen el negocio de Angelica y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos.

Angelica desea aumentar su venta de comestibles y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de frituras, golosinas, dulces, entre otros.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia, oportunidad que le brinda la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Angelica is a humble and hardworking woman who has dedicated a large part of her life to caring for her children. She lives in the municipality of Fresno from where she carries out her sales of sweets and fried foods.

She mainly sells these foods to neighbors in the area who know Angelica's business and know they will always get delicious food.

Angelica wants to increase her food sales and work in a more comfortable way. For this reason, she requests a loan to buy various fried foods, candy, and sweets, among other things.

This loan will allow her to get her business ahead in order to obtain the necessary income that will give her the opportunity to continue supporting her family, an opportunity provided by Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy various fried foods, candy, and sweets, among other things.

loans.name: Danjuma

texts.en:
Danjuma is maize farmer from Mahauta Gimba village. As a member of Babban Gona, Danjuma is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Danjuma would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Danjuma can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Danjuma is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: An'am

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. An’am is a 33-year-old, married woman with six kids. She lives in a village near Ramallah city. An’am owns a small business — it’s a livestock farm in front her house. Her husband, who is beside her in the picture, helps her in breeding the animals, too.

An’am needs an amount of money to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them, and after that, she wants to sell them and make good profits. The business faces two main challenges. So, she asked Alibdaa for a loan of $1,500 to achieve her vision.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them, and after that, she wants to sell them and make good profits.

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells mangoes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good place, and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the perishability of products.

Florah will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of mangoes. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a fridge.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mangoes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be ambitious.

He operates a retail business where he sells cereals, bread, cooking oil, sugar, soda, and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil, flour, and other items.

His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business and have a great life.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a motorbike for transport services.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Zaruhi

texts.en:
Zaruhi is 53 years old and lives with her husband and son in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. She graduated from Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute and already has 39 years of pedagogical experience.

Now, also at the school, she works as a teacher of elementary classes. She is devoted to her work, and she likes all her pupils. Her pupils are still small and need great attention and care, as well as proper explanation and great attention in their teaching process.

Zaruhi is asking for her first Kiva loan, as she wants to buy a computer, accessories for it, and also professional pedagogical literature, which will allow her to enlarge and develop her pedagogical knowledge with innovations in that sphere.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories for it, and also professional pedagogical literature, which will allow her to enlarge and develop her pedagogical knowledge.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be reliable.

He operates a retail business where he sells cereals, bread, cooking oil, sugar, soda, and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a strategic place, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil, flour, and other items.

His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Erika Marcela

texts.es:
Erika es una humilde trabajadora residente en el municipio de Bello con una vida colmada de sueños, esperanzas y los mejores deseos para su familia. 

Es madre de 2 hijos por los cuales siempre tuvo el valor y responsabilidad de responder para que su vida fuera la mejor.

Hoy en día se gana la vida con la elaboración y venta de alimentos a base de maíz como arepas y empanadas, estos alimentos los vende desde su casa.
Le dedica 4 horas diarias a su negocio.

De las principales dificultades que debe enfrentar en su trabajo la más significativa es el alto costo de las materias primas.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima como maíz al por mayor para tener una muy buen producción en esta temporada de fin de año, así podrá tener los ingresos suficientes para continuar con su negocio y sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Erika is a humble worker who lives in the municipality of Bello. Her life is full to overflowing with dreams, hopes and best wishes for her family. She is the mother of two children, and has always acted with courage and responsibility to provide them with the best life.

She now earns a living making and selling corn-based foods such as arepas and empanadas, which she sells from her house. She works at her business for four hours every day.

Among the main difficulties that she has to confront in her work, the most significant is the high cost of raw material. She is requesting a loan to buy raw material such as corn wholesale, in order to have good production in this season at the end of the year. In this way she will be able to earn enough income to continue with her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as corn wholesale, in order to have good production in this season at the end of the year.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.en:
Jairo is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a strategic place, and his primary customers are regular.

Jairo will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business.

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Mère  de trois enfants, Abla est une femme mariée résidant à Agoè. Agée de 26 ans, Abla produit des gâteaux faite à base de la farine de blé généralement appelé « Africa Tenis ».  Abla s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend de quartier en quartier. Abla sollicite ce crédit pour commander des bols de farine de blé en vue de bien satisfaire les attentes des clients puis soutenir son mari à bien s’occuper de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Abla is married with three children, she lives in Agoè. She is 26. Abla produces cakes made with wheat flour that are usually called “Africa Tenis” Abla buys her supplies once a month at the market and sells her goods from district to district. Abla requests this loan to order bowls of wheat flour so that she can satisfy the demand of her clients, and help her husband to take good care of their children.

loans.use: to buy 34 bowls of wheat flour.

loans.name: Guillermo Cesar

texts.es:
Guillermo, de 70 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado y tiene tres hijos, de los cuales solo uno vive junto a él y le ayuda mucho en los trabajos  agrícolas, su esposa tiene un pequeña tienda con la que ayuda a los gastos de la casa.

Guillermo, desde muy joven ha trabajado en los trabajos agrícolas junto a su padre, quien fue la persona que le enseño mucho a trabajar; actualmente trabaja tres hectáreas de maíz y de jícama, pues son cultivos muy productivo.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar fertilizantes para aplicarlos a sus cultivos y asegurar una buena producción. 

Su principal sueño es tener una excelente productividad y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 70 years old, a hard-working man who completed 9th grade. He is married and has three children. One of his children lives with him and helps him with the farming. His wife has a small store that helps with the household expenses.

From a young age, Guillermo farmed with his father, who taught him about work. Today he works three hectares of corn and jícama, as these are productive crops.

The loan he seeks will be used to buy fertilizers to apply to his crops and ensure a good production. His primary dream is to have an excellent production and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to apply to his crops and ensure a good production.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 23-year-old, single man from Irbid city. He is working in a coffee shop besides his ‎education to pay for his daily expenses. He is now a student in university majoring in civil ‎engineering, and he wants to complete his studies and find a good job.‎

Mustafa has four siblings, and that causes his family's financial problems. His father cannot ‎cover the education fees alongside the household expenses.
‎
Therefore, Mustafa applied for an education loan to help him pay the university fees for this ‎semester. It will also help him to buy books that he needs.‎

loans.use: to pay the university fees for this ‎semester.

loans.name: Maria Lucelly

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 59 años de edad y vive sola. 
Actualmente se gana la vida con la venta de mercancía de la marca Omnilife; esta actividad la inició gracias al apoyo de un familiar, con este negocio ha logrado obtener ingresos para apoyar el su sustento. 

Es una persona emprendedora y luchadora, con ganas de salir adelante para seguir con su negocio. 

Este crédito que solicita con la Corporación Interactuar desea invertirlo en la compra de surtido de surtido de productos de esta marca con el fin de tener la oportunidad de incrementar sus ventas ofreciendo mayor variedad de productos que satisfagan los diversos gustos y requerimientos de sus clientes que principalmente son amigos y vecinos. 

Su principal sueño es tener gran cantidad de surtido y ampliar la cartera con los clientes buenos y aumentar sus ventas, así podrá tener un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Maria is a 59 year old woman who lives alone.

She currently makes her living selling Omnilife products. She started this business thanks to the help of a family member and with the business she has managed to obtain income to support her sustenance.

She is an enterprising person and a fighter with the desire to get ahead with her business.

She is requesting this loan from the Corporación Interactuar to buy a variety of stock from this company with the aim of having the opportunity of increasing her sales offering a greater variety of products. This will satisfy the various tastes and requirements of her clients who are mainly friends and neighbors.

Her main dream is to have a good quantity of stock and expand her portfolio with good clients and increase her sales. This will improve her well-being.

loans.use: to buy a variety of supplies to increase her income.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 22 years old. She is married with three children. She has had a groceries business for six years.

She will be using the loan to purchase carrots and tomatoes and hopes this will help her expand the business.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable business and educate her children successfully.

loans.use: to purchase carrots and tomatoes to help her expand the business.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is an ambitious young lady with a lot of willpower. She is 24 years old and lives in Al Hashmi. She is ‎working hard to move forward and further her talent.
‎
Aya studied visual arts and she is very talented. She has been involved in a large number of art ‎exhibitions inside and outside Jordan, and she has received many awards. She draws in her ‎home, but as this is not a suitable place to do her work, she has decided to open an ‎independent workshop.

Now Aya is opening the workshop and she wants to buy items that she needs for it. She is very excited about having the workshop, and about improving and developing her talent, and this motivated her to apply‎ for the loan.‎

Aya is in the prime of her life and she has a lot of positive energy that she wants to put to good use. She will be very ‎thankful if she gets the loan and is able to achieve her dreams.‎

loans.use: to open her workshop and to buy the items that she needs.

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is 53, married, and the caring father of five daughters. His oldest daughter works in the ‎private sector, and the rest of his daughters are in school.

He has a small grocery store, and he ‎wants to do expansion of his business because of the high standards of living. He is requesting a loan to buy some grocery products such as varieties of biscuits, potato ‎chips, soft drinks, and vegetables.‎

Yaser is working hard to provide a good life for his daughters. He really needs the loan ‎to help him achieve his dreams.‎

loans.use: to buy some grocery products such as varieties of biscuits, potato ‎chips, soft drinks, and vegetables.‎

loans.name: Maria Helena

texts.es:
Maria, con 27 años de edad, es madre de un hijo y responsable de su hogar junto con su esposo. 

Desde hace 8 años, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio de arreglo de uñas que inició como alternativa para generar recursos que le permitieran velar por el bienestar de su familia.

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar una moto para transportarse y poder realizar domicilios, además de poder comprar insumos como esmaltes, así estará en la capacidad aumentar su trabajo, pues los clientes estarán más cómodos, lo que le ayudará a mejorar sus ventas y los ingresos que percibe. 

Maria con su perseverancia y proyección hacia un futuro, desea hacer crecer su actividad, en la que pueda mantener una buena estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maria, 27 years old, is the mother of a son and is responsible for her home together with her husband.

Since eight years ago, she has worked in her own nail repair business that started as an alternative way to generate resources that would allow her to look after the wellbeing of her family.

Currently she requests support through a loan in order to buy a motorbike to transport herself and be able to carry out home delivery, as well as to be able to buy supplies like nail polish. In that way, she will have the capacity to expand her business, since her customers would be more comfortable, which would help her improve her sales and the income that she receives.

Maria, with her perseverance and projection for the future, wants to make her business grow, in which she can maintain good economic stability.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to carry out home delivery services.

loans.name: Rabea

texts.en:
Rabea is in the prime of her life. She is 28 years old and married with three children. She is a very ‎ambitious and patient woman with willpower. Her husband is working with a very low income, ‎and she believes that she should help him and stand together to provide a good life for them. ‎

Rabea has been selling clothes and blankets to be able to help her husband with the ‎household expenses. She started her business with a small quantity of products because of ‎the lack of liquidity. Therefore, she applied for a loan to buy more clothes and blankets ‎to increase her profits and improve the standard of living of her children. ‎

She will be very thankful to Kiva if she gets the loan.‎

loans.use: to buy more clothes and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Roukeya

texts.fr: Roukeya est une femme mariée âgée de 28 ans qui vit à Agoè. Ayant un enfant à charge, Roukeya est une marchande de sachets en plastique. Roukeya s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en circulant les quartiers environnant. Pour commander des douzaines de sachets en plastique, Roukeya nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement en vue de bien revendre et de réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et mieux couvrir les frais scolaire de ses enfants dès cette rentrée scolaire.
texts.en: Roukeya is aged 28 and married, she lives in Agoè. She has one dependent child. Roukeya sells plastic bags. Roukeya buys her stock twice each month at the market and sells her merchandise from home and travelling around the neighbouring districts. To order dozens of plastic bags, Roukeya needs this loan to finance her provision of supplies so that she can make good sales and realize a sufficient profit margin to help provide for her family's needs and cover the school fees for her children at the beginning of this new school term.

loans.use: to buy 16 dozen plastic bags.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 31-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two children who are both still attending school. She is a housewife who is dedicated to her home and her family.

Fatmeh's husband is the main income provider but his income is barely sufficient. For this reason she is now asking to take out a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l. She will use the loan to pay her children’s educational fees.

She said that this loan will definitely help her to ensure the school year for them, and this makes her very happy.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a Kiva borrower. She has seven children. She describes herself as God-fearing. She operates a tailoring business, where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her primary customers are regular buyers. She says her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a larger stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a more productive business, within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will support her family financially. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 45 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 1 hijo. 
Toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo, donde aprendió desde muy joven, las labores agropecuarias, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres; esto le ha servido para generar ingresos que solventan las necesidades básicas del hogar, ya que posee un galpón, donde cría y engorda pollos para luego venderlos. 

El cliente es un hombre enérgico, activo y trabajador, siempre va en busca de mejores opciones que le permitan seguir avanzando. 

Solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de materiales para construcción de cocheras, ampliación de galpón, compra de concentrados y vitaminas para alimentar los animales, con lo que podrá venderlos a un mejor precio de acuerdo al peso; así mejorará los ingresos que recibe para seguir aportando a la economía de su familia y velar por el bienestar de su hijo. 

Jorge sueña con ampliar su galpón y adquirir más animales, para tener una producción escalonada, que le brinde una estabilidad económica, además desea disfrutar junto a su familia de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 45 years old. He is single and has one son. He has spent his whole life in the country, where he learned farming and livestock work from a very young age thanks to his parents. This has enabled him to earn income to provide for the basic needs of his household. He has a shed where he raises and fattens chickens to sell. He is an energetic, active and hard-working man who is always looking for better options that will allow him to get ahead.

He is requesting a loan to buy construction materials in order to build pigsties and to enlarge the shed, and to buy concentrates and vitamins to feed his animals. In this way he can sell them at a better price per pound. He will also increase his income and continue to provide for his family and look after his son's well-being.

Jorge dreams of enlarging the shed and acquiring more animals, in order to have a staggered production that will provide him with economic stability. He would also like to enjoy better living conditions with his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build pigsties and  to enlarge the shed, and to buy concentrates and vitamins to feed his animals.

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
Jorge a sus 47 años de edad es soltero y tiene 3 hijos. Actualmente se dedica a trabajar como empleado en una empresa, con lo cual ha obtenido ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos. 

Jorge es un hombre luchador, dinámico y muy dedicado a su familia, por eso siempre está buscando opciones que le permitan ser una mejor persona tanto a nivel personal, como profesional. 

Es así como se motiva para solicitar el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en el pago de un curso de capacitación en Panificación, su objetivo principal es poder iniciar una panadería ya que le apasiona todo el tema de la gastronomía y quiere complementar sus conocimientos para así obtener mejores ingresos, que le permitan brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una excelente educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jorge, 47 years old, is single and has three children. He currently works as an employee in a company, with which he has obtained income to get his children ahead.

Jorge is a determined man, dynamic and very dedicated to his family. That is why he is always looking for options that will allow him to be a better person on a personal level as well as professionally.

That is why he is motivated to request this loan, with the goal of investing it into paying for a training course in baking. His main objective is to be able to start a bakery, since he is passionate about the subject of gastronomy and wants to supplement his knowledge and in that way obtain better income that will allow him to provide his family with a better quality of life and excellent education for his children.

loans.use: to be trained in a baking course.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is an 18-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents and two siblings, and they work together to meet their needs in life and to improve their standard of living.

She does her best to support her father financially through her hairdressing occupation. She started her business in 2013 by opening an equipped room at her house, and she welcomes her customers in a lovely way.

Today, to better develop her business, she is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., for the purpose of acquiring new tools and supplies. She is looking forward to developing her business and hence increasing her income. She is planning also to sell beauty products and cosmetics in the future.

loans.use: to buy new tools and supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, salt and other items. His business goal is to open another shop within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to open another outlet.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, salt and other items.

loans.name: Petros

texts.en:
Petros is 53 years old and he lives with his family in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Petros has a great experience with the partnership with Kiva and Nor Horizon and he hopes that he will manage to receive already his fifth Kiva loan.

Petros has run his small cloths trading business for 25 years, which is the only source of income for his family. He rents a stall at the Vanadzor wholesale market and sells men's and women's clothes of various fashion, sizes and seasons. He is very skilled in this field and, thanks to his polite and patient attitude he attracts a lot of customers who very soon become his loyal customers. The merchandise for his stall he brings in from the Yerevan wholesale market once a month. His wife helps him in his business and he is very happy to keep this business already many years. Petros has a son (he is a student) and a daughter.

This time again Petros relies on Kiva support since with this loan of 400.000 Armenian drams Petros wants to buy a lot winter season clothes which are already of great demand among his customers.

loans.use: to buy a lot winter season clothes which are already of great demand among his customers

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is 19, married, and has no children. Her husband is working in the army, with a low income. She attends to farming and family. That means Safaa is sticking to the ground, and she is ‎working as a farmer. She likes her work, and she dreams of owning her own farm.‎

Safaa is one of the victims of beliefs in an unjust society. She got married and became responsible ‎for the home. She decided to help her husband in the household's accumulated ‎expenses.‎ So Safaa began to sell clothes and blankets, to increase her income and improve the standard ‎of living for her husband and herself.

Now she has applied for a loan to purchase a large quantity of ‎clothes and blankets, in order to be ready for the winter season. ‎She will be blessed if she gets the loan and expands her business. She is really in need of your help.‎

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of ‎clothes and blankets, to be ready for the winter season demand.

loans.name: Zaburoni

texts.en:
Zaburoni has been a produce businessman since 2012. Mostly he deals in maize, as his major source of income. He supplements his income with proceeds from his own farming. Zaburoni lives in Kagadi-Uganda. He is married and has two children, at the age of 28. He started up his produce-trading business purposely, to create employment for himself and take care of his family.

He needs money now, to buy beans for selling. Price fluctuations are his major challenge.

loans.use: to buy beans for selling.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a caring mother of seven children, which means that she has a big family with vast ‎needs. She is working hard to provide a living for them, and because she is a very helpful and ‎productive woman, she decided to help her husband in the household expenses and in the ‎education expenses for her children.‎

She is running a retail business where she sells clothes in her home to be beside her kids. She ‎has been involved in this business for five years. She describes her biggest business ‎challenge as the lack of capital.

She will use the loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will ‎own an independent shop.‎

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Helda

texts.en:
Helda is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a retail business, where she sells fruits. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her primary customers are regular buyers. She says her biggest business challenge is low stock.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a larger stock of fruits. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Olgha

texts.en:
Olgha is 41 years old, from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. She has two small sons and her mother, who is a teacher and gets 300 GEL monthly. Up until now, her salary was the only source of income for this four-member family and they found it hard to cover all daily expenses. Because of the above mentioned situation, Olgha lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience. With the family's saved money Olgha has just opened a general store locally. She already has loyal customers and gets significant income. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled her to get a loan of 2100 USD for purchasing a special refrigerator for her general store, which is a very essential thing to satisfy all her customers' needs.

Olgha will be very thankful for the financial support and kindness as her business will proceed in a more profitable way and she will make a better style of life for her children.

loans.use: To purchase a special refrigerator for her newly opened store

loans.name: Desmah

texts.en:
Desmah is married with six children. She describes herself as creative. She operates a retail business selling books and stationery. She has been involved in this business for two years.

Desmah's business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are regulars. Her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

This is Desmah's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use this loan of 35,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more stock of stationery.

Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of stationery.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as humble. He operates a restaurant. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are regular. He says his biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy a larger stock of ingredients for preparing food. His business goal is to have more business outlets within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona is 25 years old. She is married and lives with her husband, two children, and parents-in-law. The family is involved in agricultural activities. Teona is unemployed and wants to start her own business. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,100 GEL. With the received credit, she will purchase a stock of food products and will resell them from home. 

She hopes that this trading business will be profitable for her family. She is very motivated a awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin a trade in food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and other vegetables to increase her stock.

loans.name: Shorooq

texts.en: Shorooq lives with her family in Al Hashmi. She is a very kind and smart girl. Shorooq is 22 ‎years old, and she has graduated school successfully. Now she is a university student of the third ‎year. She is one of the smart students in her group, and she always tries to be ready for ‎home tasks. Shorooq is asking for a loan to pay for university tuition. She awaits your ‎mercy.‎

loans.use: to pay for her university fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 39 years old and a married man. He works in the public sector, with a low income. He has a dream, which is to complete his education and find good work, but he could not ‎achieve this dream because of the financial situation of his family. He did not give up on ‎his dream; he saved money with help from his wife, and registered in the university. He is studying in ‎the business administration major. He is very happy, and his wife encourages him a lot.‎

Now Mohammad, after having faced some financial crises, could not pay for the university. Therefore, he decided to apply for an educational loan to pay for his university fees.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Heyam

texts.en:
Heyam, 21, is studying for a degree in special education. She lives in Salheye ‎with her husband. She is working really hard to get ahead and grow.‎

Heyam dreams of having a good job to help pay for her daily expenses and ‎to help her husband with household expenses.

She is requesting this loan to pay for her educational expenses so as to continue with her ‎education and achieve her dreams.‎

loans.use: to pay her educational expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy building materials to complete the houses, including rentals and one for his family's use.

loans.name: Agali Awamu Nakulabye Group

texts.en:
Abdul is a 33-year-old Boda Boda cyclist at a health centre in Rubaga, Kampala district. He has 3 children and has been in this business for 5 years.

His wife sells irish potatoes, sweet potatoes, cassava and green bananas to contribute to the family's income.

He will use the loan to improve his wife’s business, increase their source of income, and buy more food items for sell.

loans.use: to improve her business.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny es una mujer de 42 años de edad, es casada y es madre de dos hijos. 
Actualmente tiene un negocio de restaurante, actividad que aprendió cuando decidió capacitarse para poder trabajar como independiente y generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. 

El crédito que solicita con la Corporación será invertido en un curso de capacitación en Asados y Parrilla, que le permitirá ampliar sus conocimientos y poder aumentar la venta de sus productos para generar mayores ingresos económicos. 

Su principal sueño es tener un buen negocio que le permita mantener una estabilidad económica y un mejor nivel de calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marleny is a 42-year-old woman, who is married and the mother of two children.

Currently, she has a restaurant business, which she learned when she decided to get training so she could work independently and generate the income needed to support her household.

The loan she is requesting from the corporation will be invested in a training course on Grilling and Barbecue, which will allow her to broaden her knowledge and increase the sale of her products to generate greater financial income.

Her main dream is to have a good business that allows her to maintain economic stability and a better level of quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for a course on grilling and barbecue.

loans.name: Victors Junior School

texts.en:
Pius is the Head teacher of Victors Junior School, a mixed, 400-student school in the rural area of Masaka. Victors Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Victors School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Pius ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Tapata Group

texts.en:
Memory is 26 and married. Her husband works as a welder. She has one child.

Memory sells second-hand shoes for a living. She is going to buy a bale of shoes with this loan. She started her business to support her husband in providing food for the family and sending her child to school. The profits from the business helps her feed her family.

She hopes to build a house and hopes her business will grow to an extent where she will be able to buy three bales of shoes from one bale in future.

loans.use: to buy more bales of shoes.

loans.name: Tikondane Group

texts.en:
Alice is 54 years old and married. She has four children, one orphan, two relatives, and three other people that depend on her. Her husband runs a small business selling fish.

Alice owns a business selling second hand clothes, fish, and vegetables. She started the business to support her family and relatives financially. She also wanted to be self-dependent. She would like to use this loan to buy more second hand clothes, fish, and vegetables for her business. One family member and two employees help with the running of the business.

The profits from the business will help Alice to pay for her children's school fees and to provide daily household necessities. She plans to build a new house and to renovate her current house. She also plans to have a tap of running water at her house. She will sell the water to people in the surrounding area.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes, fish, and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married with two children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business, selling sugar, bread, salt, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years.

Ruth's business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are regulars. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Here previous loans were repaid successfully.

She will use this loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more stock, including sugar, bread and flour. She will use her anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

Her business goal is to have a mini supermarket within five years. She hopes to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock, including sugar, bread and flour.

loans.name: Ineza Group

texts.en:
Andre is 30 years old and is married with two children who are between 3 and 8 years old. He is well-known in the business of selling men`s cloths which he has been doing for about eight years. Andre is the president of this group INEZA; he is the one who raised up his hand. 

Andre's hours of selling clothes are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day and currently he has one employee to help him in his business. He wants to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more and different kind of men`s clothes for sale. With the profit from this loan, Andre will be able to purchase enough food for the family, to buy new clothes for the children, to pay school fees for his children, to buy medical insurance for his family, and to renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of men`s clothes.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline trades in clothes as her major source of income. She has done this since 2008, and she supplements her income with farming. She lives in Kagadi-Uganda; she is 46 years old and married. She engages in business so that she can meet her family’s needs.

She will use the credit to buy cloth for tailoring and resale, to increase her stock. She has dreams of educating her children. Her major challenges are competition from people with similar businesses, and a lack of enough manpower to finish the available work on time.

loans.use: to buy cloth for tailoring and resale.

loans.name: Geno Hernan

texts.es:
Geno es un campesino de Sahagún, a sus 69 años de edad, se desempeña como productor lechero, actividad que aprendió de la mano de su padre y que ahora le permite generar recursos para solventar las necesidades del hogar. La producción del líquido blanco es vendida a un vecino que posee tanques de frío y así ha logrado ganarse la vida durante los 20 años que lleva desarrollando la labor.

El crédito que solicita es una alternativa para fortalecer su actividad, ya que con el dinero desea comprar una novilla preñada, con el ánimo de incrementar su producción y mejorar los ingresos, así podrá hacerle frente a los desafíos que se le presentan por los altos costos de los insumos agrícolas y por la inestabilidad en el precio de venta del producto.

Geno manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir fortaleciendo su labor y aumentar su capacidad de producción, así podrá tener una estabilidad económica favorable y mejorará la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Geno is a farmer from Sahagun. He is 69 years old and works as a milk producer, an activity which he learned from his father. Now it allows him to generate income so he can pay household expenses. The milk produced is sold to a neighbor who has cold vats. This is how he has made a living for the 20 years that he has been working in this field.

The loan he is requesting is a way to strengthen his business. He will use it to buy a pregnant heifer to increase his production and improve his income. This way he can face the challenges presented by the high cost of agricultural supplies and the instability of the price of the product.

Geno says that his greatest dream is to continue improving his business and increase production capacity, so that he can have positive economic stability and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a pregnant heifer to increase his production and improve his income.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, 20, is single and has no children. He is a likable student at the ‎university. He is majoring in capacity engineering, and he studies a lot to achieve his goals in life. His goals are to finish his university studies successfully and to be a good ‎engineer.

Mohammad will use the loan to pay his university fees and buy the books he needs. ‎He is very grateful for the help and thanks you for providing the opportunity.‎

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel de 48 años es un hombre entregado a su familia, motivo que lo impulsa a disfrutar y compartir cada instante de su existencia con sus hijos y esposa.

Este hombre debió tomar las riendas del hogar desde hace mucho tiempo y ha generado los ingresos para la alimentación y la educación de sus hijos menores de edad. 

Radicado en el municipio de San Pedro, Miguel decidió iniciar con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes. 

Hoy tiene un gran sueño, tener la tienda de productos de la canasta familiar más grande del barrio, aprovechando la necesidad del sector en donde reside. 

Para materializar su deseo, este luchador se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de vitrina, adecuaciones locativas y surtido. 

Espera que su idea de negocio le permita mejorar las condiciones de vida a su familia y terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Miguel is 48 years old and is very dedicated to his family. This motivates him to enjoy and share every moment of his life with his wife and children.

This man had to take responsibility for home affairs a long time ago and has created the income to feed and educate his young children.  Living in the town of San Pedro, Miguel decided to open a small grocery store. 

Today he has achieved his dream of having the largest basic goods store in his neighborhood, having taken advantage of the need for one in the area where he lives. To reach his goal, this determined man is requesting a loan that he will invest in a display case, improvements to the store, and stock. 

He hopes that his business idea will allow him to improve his family’s living conditions and to finish building his home.

loans.use: to buy a display case, improvements to the store, and stock.

loans.name: Lesbia Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una campesina de 55 años de edad que vive en unión libre. 

Durante toda su vida productiva se ha dedicado a ser productor agropecuario, pues posee cultivos y animales, cuyas producciones son recolectadas y vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio donde reside; actualmente trabaja con su esposo quien es su mayor apoyo, lo que para él significa tener un negocio familiar muy bueno. 

Ha atravesado múltiples dificultades económicas, sin embargo, con esfuerzo, amor y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante y siempre va en busca de nuevas alternativas que le permitan continuar avanzando; es por ello que solicita un apoyo crediticio, con el que desea comprar una vaca de levante, pues desea aumentar los ingresos y brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar. 

Maria sueña con hacer de sus actividades un negocio rentable, que perdure en el tiempo y que le garantice una estabilidad económica, pues su principal sueño es poder comprarse una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Maria is a 55 year old farmer who lives in a common law marriage.  

She has made a living as a farmer for her entire working life. She has crops and animals, whose outputs she collects and sells in her town’s market plaza. She currently works with her husband who is her greatest supporter, which, for him, means having a great family business.  

She has run into many economic difficulties, however, with hard work, love and dedication she has gotten by and is always looking for new ways to keep going. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy a young cow. She wants to increase her income and provide for the well being of her family. 

Maria dreams of working in a profitable business that can stand the test of time and guarantee economic stability. Her biggest dream is to be able to buy a home.

loans.use: to buy a young cow to increase her income and provide for the well being of her family.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos, hace 1 año se dedica a críar y comercializar cerdos, actividad que aprendió con su familia desde que era muy joven. 

Su negocio inició cuando compró unos marranos con algunos ahorros que tenía, los engordó y luego los sacrificó para venderlos por kilos, viendo que esto le generaba buenas ganancias, cada vez compraba más cerdos para engorde y empezó a trabajar diariamente en esta actividad, de esta manera ha logrado generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su familia, que está conformada por sus padres y hermanos. 

Su empuje, esmero y dedicación la impulsan a buscar alternativas que le permitan seguir avanzando, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar concentrado para el engorde de los animales; lo que le permitirá aumentar su producción y satisfacer la demanda de este tipo de carne que se incrementa con la llegada de la temporada decembrina; mejorando así la entrada de recursos económicos para su familia. 

Esto le abrirá la posibilidad de seguir creciendo con su labor, adicionalmente podrá llegar a cumplir el sueño de adecuar un espacio más amplio en el que pueda tener mayor número de animales, lo que para Carlos significa fortalecer y acreditar su actividad, y con la que podrá mejorar las condiciones de vida y el bienestar de las personas que ama.
texts.en:
Carlos began working in raising and selling pigs one year ago. He has been learning this line of work with his family since he was very young. 

His business began when he bought some pigs with his savings. He fattened them up and slaughtered them to sell by the kilo. He saw that this made good profits and he began to buy more and more pigs to fatten up and this became his daily work. He has been able to earn income to contribute to the expenses of his family, which is made up of his parents and siblings.  

His drive, hard work and dedication push him to search for options that allow him to keep going. So, he is requesting a loan to buy feed concentrate to fatten up his animals. This will allow him to increase production and meet the demand for this kind of meat, which increases in the holiday season. This will improve his family's income. 

This will give him the possibility to continue growing his work and he can achieve his dream of buying a larger space where he can have more animals. To Carlos, this would mean strengthening and giving credit to his work, which can improve the living conditions and well being of the people he loves.

loans.use: to buy feed concentrate to fatten up his animals.

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.es:
Raúl, de 43 años de edad, está casado, vive con su esposa y juntos tienen 3 hijos, todos sus hijos son independientes y ya tienen sus propias familias cada uno y al igual que su padre se dedican a la apicultura, la cual consiste en el cultivo y manejo de colmenas de abejas. 

Raúl, se dedica al manejo de colmenas de abejas, este trabajo es difícil y hay que ser muy cuidadoso, pero al igual es un trabajo muy interesante y productivo; Raúl posee 20 años de experiencia en el manejo de colmenas, tanto es su conocimiento sobre la apicultura que es un exportador de miel producida por sus colmenas, la cantidad de producción que exporta al extranjero ronda los 20 barriles de miel y está muy feliz con su producción y con su negocio porque es estable. 

Raúl, necesita el préstamo para comprar algunos materiales que necesita para el mantenimiento de sus colmenas, por ejemplo marcos de madera, cubetas, zarandas y cajones de madera para poder seguir criando sus abejas productoras de miel. 

Los sueños de Raúl, es ser uno de los exportadores de miel más grandes del pais y convertirse en un empresario éxitoso y disfrutar de ese éxito junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Raul is 43, married and lives with his wife, with whom he has 3 children. All of his children are independent and have their own families. Still, their father works in beekeeping, which consists of cultivating and managing bee hives. 

Raul makes a living managing bee hives. This work is difficult and requires a lot of care, but it is an interesting and productive job. Raul has 20 years of experience managing bee hives. He knows so much about beekeeping that he exports the honey from his hives. He exports around 20 barrels of honey. He is very happy with his production and business because they are stable.  

Raul needs the loan to buy some materials necessary for managing his bee hives, for example: wooden frames, trays, sieves and wooden drawers to continue raising his honey bees. 

Raul’s dream is to be one of the country’s largest exporters of honey and become a successful businessman and enjoy that success with his family.

loans.use: to buynecessary materials for managing his bee hives, for example: wooden frames, trays, sieves and wooden drawers to continue raising his bees.

loans.name: Carolina Isabel

texts.es:
Carolina vive con sus 3 hijos felizmente en zona rural del municipio de Momil.

En la actualidad ya cumplió 4 años de estar trabajando con la cría de cerdos de engorde, actividad con la que ha intentado sobrevivir y sacar adelante a su familia para que nunca les falte nada. 

Ha tenido dificultades económicas que han afectado su negocio y que la han obligado a detener sus actividades en ciertas ocasiones. 

Sueña con mejorar el lugar para la cría de sus animales y también con tener una planta de engorde de cerdos, por esto pasa la solicitud de un préstamo, el cual invertirá en la compra cerdos de engorde los cuales tienen muy buena aceptación por la buena crianza y mantenimiento de los mismos. 

Su calidad de vida  y la de su familia se incrementará en la medida que aumentan las ventas de sus animales y alcance las metas establecidas para  un futuro no lejano.

Con el apoyo de este préstamo Carolina podrá continuar trabajando y podrá darle a su familia todo lo mejor.
texts.en:
Carolina lives happily with her 3 children en a rural section of the municipaity of Momil.

Presently, she has worked for 4 years raising pigs for fattening and with the business she has tried to survive and get ahead with her family so they always have what they need. She has had some financial difficulties that have affected her business and that have forced her to suspend her operations on certain occasions.

She dreams of improving the place where she raises the animals and also to have a pig fattening plant and that is why she is applying for a loan. She will invest it in the purchase of pigs for fattening, which are in demand when well-raised and kept.

Her quality of life and that of her family will improve as the sales of her animals increase and she attains the goals she's established for a not-so-distant future. With the support of this loan, Carolina will be able to continue working and will be able to give her family only the best.

loans.use: to buy pigs for fattening, which are in demand when well-raised.

loans.name: Circle Of Peace School

texts.en:
Marylove is the Head teacher of Circle of Peace Nursery School, a mixed, 350-student school in the Urban area of Makindye in Kampala. Circle of Peace School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Circle of Peace School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Marylove ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Misesa Group

texts.en:
Joyce is 29 years old and divorced. She provides for her three children, two orphans, and one relative.

Joyce owns a restaurant. She would like to use this loan to buy maize flour, rice, sugar, salt, and chicken for the restaurant. She started her business to become financially stable and self-dependent. She has two family members that help with the day-to-day activities of the business.

Joyce will use the profits from her restaurant to feed her family every day. She hopes to own a building where she can operate her restaurant from. She also hopes to employ more people in the future.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice, sugar, salt, and chicken.

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es:
Isaias es un humilde trabajador residente en el municipio de Bello con una vida colmada de sueños, esperanzas y los mejores deseos para su familia. Es padre de 1 hijo por el cual siempre tuvo el valor y responsabilidad de responder para que su vida fuera la mejor.

Hoy en día se gana la vida con la venta de frutas, estos alimentos los transporta en un vehículo y los vende de manera ambulante.
Le dedica 8 horas diarias a su negocio.

De las principales dificultades que debe enfrentar en su trabajo son las fuertes lluvias y el alto costo de las frutas.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de inventario de frutas como mango, naranja, piña, entre otras.
texts.en:
Isaias is a simple worker who lives in the municipality of Bello but has a life full of dreams, hopes and best wishes for his family. He is the father of one son who he has always had the courage and responsability to support so his life could be the best possible.

He presently makes his living selling fruit, transporting the foods in a vehicle and selling them door-to-door. He dedicates 8 hours a day to his business. Some of the greatest difficulties he faces in his work are the heavy rains and the high cost of fruit.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy inventory in fruits such as mangoes, oranges, pineapples, etc.

loans.use: to buy inventory in fruits such as mangoes, oranges, pineapples, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna has been an active member of CCT for many years. She recieved several loans from the cooperative which she used to support her business. She successfully repaid the loan and improved her way of life.

She has had a direct selling business for many years. Most of her relatives, friends and neighbors buy from her because of the reasonable discounts. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and personal care products like Avon, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange. Dealers like Edna buy the pre-ordered products in cash, then these products are given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and from these they earn their profits.

Edna also earns additional income selling chorizo, hotdogs, and ham.

She requests 26,000 to buy more products for her business.

Edna hopes that her business will thrive more. She aims someday to own and manage a bigger business to help her cope with their daily needs and expenses. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear items, cosmetics, personal care products, and various frozen foods.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Practically, direct selling business allows customers to shop without sweat. Another awesome perk: they have one-month-to-pay credit for any goods they get. They just have to browse from brochures, place orders, and wait for a day or two for the direct selling representative (or dealer) to deliver the orders, then pay the amount by installment in a month’s stretch.

Joy, 54 years old, from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental, is into direct selling business. She has different brochures of known brands such as Ever Bilena, Natasha, Personal Collection, Dakki, Avon, and Marikina Shoe Exchange. She shows these brochures to her customers where they can choose from different line of products. There are cosmetics, toiletries, RTWs, footwear, bags, even pillows and household needs. Usually, dealers have 25% discount (or higher) of brochure price, which serves as their profit. They also earn from rebates, recruitment rewards, etc.

Joy meticulously studies the specifications of every product in her brochures so she can easily answer the queries of her customers. Because of this positive attitude, she has gained their trust and confidence. Now she is expanding her network of target customers.

She is expecting a higher demand for her products as the peak season of Christmas approaches. Therefore, she has applied for additional capital worth 20,000 PHP to meet this. Her continuous income adds up to the monthly pension of her husband, Roquito, and supports their usual needs and college expenses of their youngest child.

She desires good health, brighter future for her children, and harmonious relationship among her family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products for her direct selling business.

loans.name: Phebe

texts.en:
Phebe has operated a “sari-sari” variety store business for 10 years in her community in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. She sells shampoo, cookies, candies, condiments, rice, charcoal, and cellphone minutes. She plans to start businesses to raise hogs and rent motorcycles.

She and her husband, Raymund, a driver, do their best to reach their dream and raise professional children. They aim to have sufficient resources not only for their family but also to extend help to other people in need.

She would like a 30,000 PHP loan to buy dry goods, grocery items, beverages, rice, and charcoal for her store. She will also set aside some amount for her e-loading business. She’s thankful that CCT is providing her with valuable tips on how to manage their businesses properly. She draws inspiration from their sharing of testimonies and reflection on the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy dry goods, grocery items, beverages, rice, and charcoal.

loans.name: Teso College School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Sylvester. He is an Administrator of Teso College School, a boys school in the rural area of Soroti with 2000 students.

Teso College School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with 450 litre & 1000 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Teso College School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Sylvester ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases. This will also help increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Yaha

texts.en:
Yaha is a maize farmer from Gwani village. As a Babban Gona member, Yaha is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior farming inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tones of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, Yaha would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Yaha will use this loan to store the maize she harvests, enabling her to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yaha no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/ha, Yaha hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gjyste

texts.en:
Gjyste was widowed very long ago. She was a mother of a young child then and she is now in her early 60s. During these past 25 years, she's been doing rural activities, including agriculture/livestock. Her family owns some agricultural land where Gjyste has been planting orchards and plants every year, mostly wheat and corn, and of course seasonal veggies for the family. 

At the moment, she also has a saw and sixty chickens. Whatever she makes from the activity is the ultimate source of income for her family. She's got no other incomes. "I work everyday in the field and then I have to take care of the saw and piglets that every four months, I've approximately six newborn piglets. So i have to raise and sell them. It's lots of work to be done by one person," said Gjyste to the branch assistant during the interview for Kiva.
 
Gjyste is requesting an amount of 50,000 ALL (Albanian Lek) to repair the roofing because it is currently leaking.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her family house.

loans.name: Marka

texts.en:
Marka is a maize farmer from Gwani village. As a Babban Gona member, Marka is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior farming inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tones of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, Marka would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Marka will use this loan to store the maize she harvests, enabling her to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Marka no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/ha, Marka hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Asomdwe Wura Group

texts.en: Ernestina is a 50-year-old womanfrom Twifo Praso in the Twifo Atti-Morkwa District of the Central Region of Ghana. Ernestina (pictured in the middle) is the leader of Asomdwe Wura Group. She is married and has 3 children aged 4, 18, and 22 years old. Ernestina’s husband is a mason who supports her.  She sells rice, gallons of cooking oil, toffee, and biscuits. Ernestina's  friend uses Elsa Stove for cooking  and shared her experience with Ernestina. Ernestina was interested and visited the friend to see how the stove works.  Ernestina has decided to add distribution of Elsa Stoves to her business. She conducted a market survey and has a convincing outcome. The stoves use palm kernel shells which are  available as waste material within the communities. There is high demand of Elsa Stoves since they cook for a longer period and improve indoor air quality. Moreover, the fuel cost is zero within the communities who have kernel shells as waste material from their oil processing. Ernestina and her group members need micro loans to buy more Elsa Stoves to meet the high increasing demand. Funding their loan will put an end to the cutting down of trees for firewood by the communities. Ernestina and her group members are grateful to all Kiva micro lenders for their support to help preserve the forest within their business communities.

loans.use: to buy Elsa Stoves for resale

loans.name: Blessing Group

texts.en:
Adwoa is a 49-year-old married woman sitting at the right side in the group picture, from Hemang in the Twifo Lower Denkyira District of the Central Region of Ghana. Adwoa is a member and group representative of Blessing Group. She has 3 children who are 17, 20,and 22 years old, all attend school. Adwoa's husband is a cocoa farmer who has been a very responsible and supportive husband. Adwoa sells sacks of maize, flour, millet, yam,and sugar. Her sister introduced her to Elsa Stove; she developed interest and decided to add it to her line of business to help eradicate the use of harmful methods of cooking in their rural communities. She has done a market survey and has good outcome since more women were interested in the stove. Elsa stove uses pellets which are always available as waste materials in the surrounding communities they intend operating. She contacted the Field Partner for community education within her market segment. There is high demand for the Elsa stoves because it improves indoor air quality and health of users. Additionally, the stove users make savings in their household energy expenditure on fuel.

Adwoa will use the current loan to buy more stoves to meet the increasing demand she faces. Funding her loan will help reduce deforestation in their communities as the stove users will no longer cut the wood from the forest for firewood or use charcoal for fuel. Adwoa and her group member thank Kiva micro lenders for their generosity and help to save the forest within their business communities.

loans.use: to purchase Elsa Stoves for resale.

loans.name: Megyefo Nyame Group

texts.en:
This six-member group named Megyefo Nyame is located at Chorkor in the greater Accra region of Ghana. They have satisfactory performance in business due to their hard work.

Victoria is a married woman with three children, all attend school. She fells gari (cassava grains) and oil to increase her capital and provide the necessary food items for her customers. She seeks 4400.00 GHS. She will repay the loan and is grateful to Kiva.

loans.use: to increase her earnings and provide food items for her customers.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tones of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer).

Traditionally, Yusuf would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/ha, Yusuf now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Consuelo De Nieve

texts.es:
Consuelo es una mujer campesina de 43 años de edad, trabajadora y humilde, que desde niña aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 

Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee cultivos de plátano y yuca, cultivos que atiende todos los días y las cosechas son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Montería, adicionalmente, realiza labores de ama de casa.

Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado en la Corporación Interactuar, comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor como abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros, con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, más productiva y así mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos.

Consuelo, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a hard-working, humble country woman who is 43 years old. Since she was a girl, she learned to handle all the chores done in the country, thanks to the teachings of her parents.

This has allowed her to progress, and today she has both plantain and cassava crops. She tends to her crops every day and the harvest is sold in the farmer's market in the municipality of Montería. In addition, she does housekeeping.
