With the support of the loan requested from Corporación Interactuar, she will buy agricultural supplies wholesale, such as compost, pesticides, fertilizers and other items, to continue to care for her crops and have a better harvest, a more productive harvest and thereby increase her income when she sells her produce.

Consuelo, with her enterprising spirit, her drive and tenacity, wants to keep striving to achieve her dream of having her own farm, where she can grow a wider variety of produce and improve the profitability of her business, thereby guaranteeing the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies wholesale, such as compost, pesticides, fertilizers and other items, to continue to care for her crops and have a better harvest.

loans.name: Liliana Marcela

texts.es:
Liliana es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha salido adelante.

Liliana es soltera y desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender productos de uso personal a través de catálogo, con gran esfuerzo ha superado muchos problemas que se le han presentado.

Actualmente Liliana tiene unos muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder tener una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, sabe que de la mano de Interactuar podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Liliana is a hard working person who has been able to get ahead thanks to her daily struggle. She is single and started selling personal use products through catalog. With great effort she's been able to overcome many problems along the way.
Currently, Liliana has very good orders from her clients but because she doesn't have a lot of capital she's requesting a loan to buy personal use products and respond to large requests from her clients.
Her greatest dream is to get ahead with her business and be able to have a good quality of life and better economic stability. She knows that with the help of Interactuar she'll be able to do it.

loans.use: buy personal use products and respond to larger requests from her clients.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Iliya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tones of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, Iliya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Iliya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Iliya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Iliya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Bature

texts.en:
Bature is a maize farmer from Maidawa village. As a Babban Gona member, Bature is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior farming inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tones of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, Bature would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Bature will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Bature no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/ha, Bature hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Children's Wear Group

texts.en:
Joana is a 56-year old woman from Mankessim in the Mfantsiman District of the Central Region of Ghana.

Joana (first on the left in the photo) is the group representative of Children’s Wear group. Joana is married and lives with her family. She has 6 children but the youngest is currently pursuing his tertiary education. Joana’s husband is a retired educator and very supportive. She has sold clothes, shoes, and jeans for 25 years.

Joan has been with the Field Partner 2010 to grow her business to the current level through micro loan support. She has successfully repaid her previous loans with the Field Partner. Joana’s main challenge is the size of her shop. She will use the current loan to buy feeding bottles, baby dresses, shoes, jeans shorts, and trousers. Joana will use part of her profit to expand her shop. She has been able to buy a piece of land from savings. Joana and her group members thank all their Kiva micro lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy  feeding bottles, baby dresses, shoes, jeans shorts, and trousers.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
Jaime es un campesino de 30 años de edad, padre de 1 hijo y vive en unión libre con su pareja. 

Viene de una familia humilde y trabajadora del campo, que le inculcaron desde pequeño el amor y el cuidado por la tierra, gracias a ello, hoy en día es agricultor, en su finca tiene unas plantas de maíz recién sembradas, la cosecha que recolecta la vende en la plaza de mercado y así genera los ingresos necesarios para llevar el sustento a su hogar. 

Es aguerrido y trabajador, se proyecta hacia el cumplimiento de sus objetivos, esto lo motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para comprar los insumos agrícolas (fungicidas, larvicidas, abonos e insecticidas), que son necesarios para mejorar los cultivos y poder recolectar una cosecha más productiva, que le genere mejores ingresos por ventas. 

Así, Jaime podrá continuar avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es llegar a tener un cultivo mas grande, pues desea aprovechar al máximo el terreno que tiene disponible, logrando generar una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a su familia la oportunidad de prepararse y ser unas personas íntegras, además podrá brindar un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jaime is a 30-year-old farmer. He is the father of 1 son and is in a common-law marriage with his partner.

He comes from a humble family of farm workers, who instilled in him--from a young age--a love and respect for the land. Thanks to this, today, he is a farmer. In his farm, he has recently planted corn crops. He sells his harvest in the market and, thus, generates the income he needs to bring sustenance to his household.

He is brave and hard working, and he thinks toward achieving his goals. This is why he requests the support of a loan to buy agricultural supplies (fungicides, larvicides, mane, and insecticides), which are necessary to improve his crops and to enable him to have a more productive harvest. This will generate more income for him through sales.

In this way, Jaime will be able to continue advancing toward completing his main dream, which is to have a very large crop. He wants to take full advantage of the land that he has and to succeed in generating a stable income to give his family the opportunity to better themselves and to be upstanding people. He will also be able to offer a better wellbeing and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (fungicides, larvicides, manure, and insecticides).

loans.name: Pablo Enrique

texts.es: Pablo es casado y tiene 3 hijos Cristian de 2,Gandy 5 y Luis 7 años de edad, vive en la casa que le presta su madre, son 6 años que Pablo y su esposa se dedican a este negocio, pero hace 4 años cuando nuestra institucion les brindo el crédito pudieron mejorarlo y readecuar sus galpones, adicionalmente se dedican a la agricultura de algún huerto pequeño, el esta ocasión Pablo va a invertir el crédito en la compra de pollos para ponerlos en un gal que en la actualidad esta vacio, lo que Pablo aspira es seguir trabajando duro para que sus hijos sigan estudiando y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pablo is married and has 3 children: Cristian, 2 year old; Gandy, 5 years old, and Luis, 7 years old. He lives in a house that his mother loans to him. For 6 years now, Pablo and his wife have worked this business, but it was 4 years ago that this institution offered them a loan and they were able to improve the business and renovate their hen houses. They also work farming a small crop garden.

At this time, Pablo is going to invest the loan in the purchase of chickens to put them in a coop that is currently empty. Pablo aspires to continue working hard so his sons can continue studying and to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to increase the number of chickens he has.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Samaila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tones of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Samaila can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Samaila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Samaila is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Musa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tones of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Musa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Musa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Musa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es: Doña Maria de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con con su esposo, ella posee una tienda en su casa de habitación en la cual vende variedad de productos de primera necesidad su deseo es ampliar su tienda con el fin de mejorar las ventas y sus ingresos ya que desea mejores condiciones de vida para ella y su esposo. Por lo anterior solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de productos de tienda como: huevos, cereales, golosinas, aceite, macarrones, detergente, etc. y asi surtir con mas mecaderia su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She has a store in her home in which she sells a variety of basic needs products. She wants to grow her store with the goal of improving her sales and income, since he wants better conditions for her and her husband.

Because of this, she requests a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in buying products for her store, including eggs, cereals, sweets, oil, macaroni, detergent, etc. Thus, she will stock her business with more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy products for her store, including eggs, cereals, sweets, oil, macaroni, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Herminio con 58 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia, junto a su cónyuge e hijos, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Herminio se dedica al servicio de transporte urbano, en el distrito de Cayaltí y anexos, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 05 años aproximadamente.Solicita préstamo para mantenimiento de mototaxi y renovación de SOAT,licencia de conducir y otros gastos diversos.

Herminio socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Cuenta con experiencia crediticia.
texts.en:
Herminio is 58 years old and is in a civil marriage. He lives in his own house with his wife and children in the district of Cayaltí in the province of Chiclayo in the department of Lambayeque, Peru. The residents of this area are mostly dedicated to agriculture, business, and livestock.

Herminio is dedicated to urban transport services in the district of Cayaltí and neighboring areas. He has more than 5 years of experience. He requests the loan to maintain his motor taxi, to renew his SOAT (insurance) and driver's license, and to pay for other expenses.

Herminio is a recurring Edpyme Alternativa client. He has experience taking out loans.

loans.use: to maintain his motortaxi, to renew his SOAT (insurance) and driver's license, and to take care of other expenses.

loans.name: Steve

texts.es: Steven tiene su propio puesto en el cual vende a sus clientes variedad de frutas y verduras. Solicita un préstamo de setecientos cincuenta mil colones (₡ 750 000), para la compra de frutas y verduras que le permitan aumentar su volumen de ventas y mejorar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en: Steven has his own stall from which he sells a variety of fruits and vegetables to  his customers. He is requesting a loan of 750,000 CRC to buy fruits and vegetables that will allow him to increase the volume of his sales and improve his family's income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Hashimu

texts.en:
Hashimu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Hashimu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, Hashimu would have had to sell his maize at harvest - a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market - to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Hashimu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Hashimu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Hashimu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a better house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Dauda has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dauda would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Dauda can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Dauda will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Dauda is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramon proviene de una familia humilde, trabaja para poder cubrir sus gastos de la universidad, está estudiando la carrera de diseño gráfico, y por medio de sus conocimientos quiere poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Él está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder cumplir con su meta de ser alguien en la vida, su objetivo es poder terminar sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ramon comes from a humble family and he works to cover his university expenses. He is studying Graphic Design and he hopes that his education will enable him to improve his living conditions for himself and his loved ones.

He putting forth his best effort to achieve his goal of becoming someone in life. His aim is to complete his studies and he is asking for this loan so he can pay his tuition and continue studying.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Kukuli Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KUKULI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Valerka, la socia continua dedicándose a trabajar en uno de los colegios de la ciudad del Cusco en el área administrativa, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia también continua vendiendo productos de belleza a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de perfumes para damas.

 Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “KUKULI” communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department, Peru.

Valerka is a member who continues working in administration in one of the high schools in the city. She is a responsible and hard-working woman. She also sells beauty products to customers who seek her out. She wishes to continue working and supporting her family. She is thankful to those who become part of her dream through their support and she promises to make the loan payments on the established schedule. She seeks a loan to buy perfume for women.

The members in the inserted photos were granted permission to arrive late to the meeting due to their work. The person with the covered face does not belong to the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy perfume for women.

loans.name: Analia

texts.es:
Analia proviene de una familia digna y humilde, son de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, ella pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder ser una profesional útil a la sociedad.
Analia comenta que quiere ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de sus conocimientos, es por ello que pone todo lo mejor de sí.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Analia comes from a humble but dignified family that is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. She puts forth her best effort so that she can be a professional who is useful to society.

Analia states that she wants to help her loved ones by getting an education, which is why she gives the best of herself. She is asking for this loan so that she can pay her tuition and continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition.

loans.name: Olga Patricia

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer de campo y madre de 6 hijos por los que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de pollos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos pollos para cría y materiales para la construcción de un galpón.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo y sus hijos.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Olga is a woman from the countryside and she's the mother of 6 children. She's had to confront many difficult situations in her life. However, she's always had the strength to get ahead and progress with her family.
She's been wanting set up a business of breeding and selling chickens. She's requesting economic help to buy some chickens to breed and materials to build a barn.
With this new business she will be able to generate income for her family, who are everything to her, and improve the quality of life of her husband and children. She will work everyday to boost her business and make it sustainable and profitable. Please support a working woman with a loan!

loans.use: to buy some chickens to breed and materials to build a barn.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is maize farmer from Galadima Toka village. As a member of Babban Gona, Hauwa is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, she has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hauwa can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Hauwa is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use her increased earnings to ensure that all her children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Markus Mai'unguwa

texts.en:
Markus is a maize farmer from Galadima Toka village. As a member of Babban Gona, Markus is excited about the opportunity to improve the lives of his family and children. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Markus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Markus can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Markus is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family, and in the end he hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria continua con sus estudios en enfermería, ella lucha y se esfuerza por poder crecer mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través de sus estudios, ella comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Ella pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria is still studying nursing. She works hard and makes the effort to grow and to improve her standard of living through her education. She says that her previous loan allowed her to pay her tuition, which was a great help to her.

Maria is requesting this new loan to once again pay her tuition. It will help her to continue with her studies, as she is doing. Maria is grateful for the new opportunity she is being granted to keep studying.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Delly

texts.en: Delly is 42 years old. She is known in the Ramon Magsaysay, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte area for her rice trading business. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, thus she has applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for; when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia, a responsible mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables for retail This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fruits & vegetables for retail

location.town: Sindangan-Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 56 years old and residing at Bitoon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and blessed with adult-aged children who are still in their college years. She joined PMPC on April 17, 2008 in order to access the programs and services of the co-op. Recently, she's accessing her seventh loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 for additional working capital of her existing business. She will use the loan to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas is a 32 year-old married mother of one child. She works hard to support her family. She works in a hospital. Her husband is in agriculture. Although the family works very hard, they do not have enough money to support the cost of Domingas' education. This loan of $ 1,000 will allow Domingas to help pay for the cost of studying in University. She will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies. Domingas loves her family very much and hopes that further education will help them to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Roel

texts.en: Roel thought he was in the right place when he joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. He decided to give it a try after he learned he can request financial assistance for his chosen business. Roel has maintained his membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. He has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, he requested a loan to purchase rice seeds which will have good results in producing healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Roel wishes to continuously manage his business more effectively with the support of his family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds which will have good results in producing healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

location.town: Sindangan-R.J. Macias, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia heads up for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much-needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer, thus she applied for a loan from the cooperative. Lydia hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es:
Julio es un señor de 28 años, vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Santo Domingo. Hace dos años vivía en Venezuela donde pudo trabajar duro y regresar nuevamente a Ecuador a empezar con su negocio.
Julio es cliente fidelizado de la institución, con el primer crédito pudo surtir y fortalecer el negocio de venta de sábanas y edredones,  él recorre  en su moto visitando a los clientes;  comenta que gracias al crédito pudo incrementar el negocio y actualmente ha crecido, con esas ganancias emprendió en otro negocio, ahora fabrica pequeñas estanterías que vende a sus clientes. Está feliz porque la institución le  brindó la oportunidad de salir adelante, por ello nuevamente solicita crédito para invertir en sus negocios, seguir creciendo y en un futuro contar con su pequeña fábrica para poder dar trabajo a personas que deseen salir adelante y aprender del arte.
Julio agradece enormemente a Kiva y a la institución por permitir que los pequeños microempresarios puedan fortalecer sus negocios y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Julio is a 28-year-old man. He lives in his parents' house in the city of Santo Domingo. Two years ago, he was living in Venezuela, where he was able to work hard and return once again to Ecuador to start his business.

Julio is a loyal client of the institution. With the first loan, he was able to stock and strengthen his sheet and comforter business. He travels around on his motorcycle visiting customers. He says that thanks to the loan, he was able to expand the business and it has now grown. With those profits, he started another business; he now makes small shelving units that he sells to his customers.

Julio is happy because the institution gave him the opportunity to provide for himself. That's why he is again requesting a loan to invest in his businesses, to continue growing, and, in the future, to have a small factory so that he can give jobs to people who want to get ahead and learn the art.

Julio is enormously grateful to Kiva and to the institution for allowing small business owners to be able to strengthen their businesses and keep growing.

loans.use: to diversify his shelf-making business by making shelving to sell along with sheets and comforters.

loans.name: Ishaku

texts.en:
Ishaku is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ishaku has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ishaku would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Ishaku can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Ishaku will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Ishaku is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
21 mujeres integran este grupo formado en la ciudad de Encarnación, están en su segundo ciclo, y también todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando y esforzándose para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Todas y cada una de las integrantes de este grupo está poniendo lo mejor de sí para poder crecer y mejorar en sus emprendimientos, pero entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Clara, ella es la presidenta de este grupo, una mujer muy luchadora que con sacrificio está esforzándose por sus seres queridos, al mismo tiempo tiene su negocio de despensa, que poco a poco ha ido mejorando y a través del cual ayuda a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, frutas, carne, panificados, enlatados, bebidas y otros, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus ventas, y mejorar también su negocio y seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Twenty-one women make up this communal bank in Encarnación. They are in their second lending cycle, and all of them are also participating in the Poverty Stoplight Program. They work hard and put forth effort to improve their own standards of living and those of their loved ones as well.

Each and every one of the communal bank members is putting forth the best of herself to be able to grow and improve her enterprise. Among them, one woman stands out, Sra. Clara. Sra. Clara is the president of the communal bank. She is a very hard-working woman who, through sacrifices, is putting forth so much effort for the sake of her loved ones. Her business is a small grocery that, little by little, has been improving and with which she is able to help her family.

Sra. Clara is requesting this loan so she can purchase vegetables, fruit, meat, baked goods, canned goods, beverages and other items. With this purchase, she will be able to continue selling her products, improving her business and helping her loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruit, meat, baked goods, canned goods, beverages and other products to stock up her grocery.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 8 de Diciembre está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante, todas son amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Ybycuí, ellas se pusieron como meta poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona.
La Sra. Sady, una de las que integra este grupo pide este préstamo para compra de chanchos, gallinas y otros, para criar y venderlos; ya que ese es su humilde trabajo, y con lo cual da a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Sady agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder formar parte de este grupo y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group "December 8th" is in its 4th cycle of the women's committee program where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. They are all friends and neighbors of the city of Ybycuí. They established as a goal to help each other out and grow, not only financially, but personally also.
Mrs. Sady is one of the women who make up this group and she's requesting a loan to buy pigs, chickens and other animals to breed and sell which is her humble job and how she gives to her family what she couldn't have before. Sady is grateful for the opportunity she's receiving of being part of this group and being able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, and other animals to breed and sell.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en: Jovita has always dreamed of opening her own store to support her two children. She applied for a loan from Paglaum MPC to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. She hopes to maintain a good repayment record so that she can always run back to the cooperative for any financial assistance.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Deodita

texts.en: Deodita is a businesswoman in Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 51 years old, married, and a microfinance member of PMPC. Deodita runs a retail store selling consumable goods. Running this type of business has supported her family, especially in the education of her children. Recently, she applied for a loan to buy bamboo thatch, wood, sticks, and nails for house repair. Deodita is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to buy bamboo thatch, wood, sticks, and nails for house repair.

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Belly

texts.en:
Belly is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her pig business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and a mother who never tires of supporting her family.

She recently took out a loan to purchase bags of animal feed and vitamins. Aside from her project of building concrete pig pens, she is considering adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Flor De Amapola Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, es un comité nuevo que se formó en la ciudad de Itá, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras, luchadoras y sacrificadas, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de vida de cada una de las integrantes, y conforme a ello poder trabajar por su superar su situación de pobreza.
Cada una de las integrantes del grupo es muy trabajadora y luchadora, pero entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Susana, ella hace comidas de todo tipo, todos los días se levanta muy temprano para poder preparar las comidas que venderá y después las sale a ofrecer por su barrio. Ella tiene muy buena clientela, y es lo que le ayuda a dar a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas, panificados y otros productos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas y cumpliendo así con sus clientes.
texts.en:
There are seventeen woman who make up this communal bank. They are a newly formed communal bank in Itá. They are very hard-working, determined and selfless women. They are participating in the Poverty Stoplight Program, which will enable them each to better understand her particular situation and, from there, be able to work to improve her level of poverty.

Every one of the members of the communal bank is very hard-working and determined, but one member stands out, Sra. Susana. Sra. Susana prepares all types of food. Every day, she gets up early to make the food that she will later sell throughout her neighborhood. She has a very good clientele, and that is what helps her to give her family a respectable life free of privations.

Sra. Susana is requesting this loan so she can purchase vegetables, meat, condiments, greens, baked goods and other products. The purchase will help her continue making food and meeting her customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, condiments, greens, baked goods and other products she needs to make the food she sells.

loans.name: Mangoty Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, es un grupo bastante numeroso que se unió para que cada una pueda capacitarse y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza esforzándose por superar las limitaciones de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Melissa quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de su copetín tiene los ingresos que necesita para dar a su familia una vida digna. Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre va hasta su negocio ya que tiene todo tipo de productos y es lo que les atrae.
La Sra. Melissa solicita de este préstamo para poder comprar más productos  para su copetín, como ser bebidas, golosinas, comestibles, galletitas y otros, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group formed in the city of San Lorenzo. They are friends and neighbors of the city. It's a quite numerous group that came together so they could get trained and improve their quality of life. They are also part of the program for the eradication of poverty by making an effort to overcome their obstacles.
One of the members is Mrs. Melissa who through her effort and continuous work in her restaurant/bar which provides her with the income she needs to give her family a dignified life. She has very good clientele in her business because she has all types of products which attracts them there.
Mrs. Melissa is requesting a loan to buy more products for her restaurant/bar, including drinks, candy, food, crackers, and other items so that she can continue with her sales as she has until now.

loans.use: to buy more products for her restaurant/bar, including drinks, candy, food, crackers and other items.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn es estudiante de la carrera de Trabajo Social, vive con sus padres y  hermanas en la  ciudad de San Lorenzo, ella trabaja como un medio para poder tener los medios para ser alguien en la vida.
Ella está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia a través de sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a student of Social Work. She lives with her parents and sisters in the city of San Lorenzo. She is working to be able to have the means to be someone in live.

She puts great effort into being able to improve her and her family's living situation after finishing her studies.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay for her tuition fees and this be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Lorenza es una mujer de 50 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene hijos independientes, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es constante, emprendedora y muy amable. Su negocio lo realiza ambulante mente en ferias y áreas comerciales del centro de la ciudad.
Lorenza es de baja estatura, cabello gris y físico robusto (la primera de la derecha, viste pantalón azul). Su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. El deseo por mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; venta de comida, taller eléctrico automotriz, venta de cosméticos, tienda de barrio, venta de productos naturales para la salud, venta de lácteos y pintura de interiores. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, actividad que realiza visitando ferias y áreas comerciales de forma libre y exponiendo la ropa en la calle sobre un plástico para que no toque el suelo, “las personas que no cuentan con demasiados recursos económicos pueden darse un capricho a bajo costo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede visitar  a muchos clientes, la desventaja es la falta de variedad de ropa. Su sueño es tener un puesto fijo de venta, ella desea comprar ropa de segunda mano por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lorenza solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa usada por mayor para vender ambulantemente en ferias.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a 50-year-old woman who lives with her partner. She has three independent children, and a business selling second-hand clothing. She is persevering, enterprising and very friendly. Her business takes place at street fairs and commercial areas in the city center. Lorenza is short, has grey hair and is physically strong (she is the first person on the right, wearing blue trousers). Her mother tongue is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish.

Her life is shared with her partner who works in the business, and they live in a brick room of their own construction which has all the basic services. The desire to improve her business led her to lead the entrepreneurship bank, and the businesses of the partners are: food sales, an automotive electrics workshop, cosmetics sales, a neighborhood shop, the sale of natural health products, milk sales, and interior house painting. 

Her business is the sale of second-hand clothing, which she does by visiting fairs and open commercial areas and displaying the clothes, in the street, on a piece of plastic so that they don't touch the ground. "People who don't have very many economic resources can indulge at a low cost," she says. 
The advantage of her business is that she can visit many customers, and the disadvantage is the lack of variety of clothes. 

Her dream is to have a fixed stall to sell from, and she wants to buy second-hand clothing wholesale. This is the first sequence of loans with this institution in the two years since they started to do this activity, and it is for this reason that Lorenza has requested a loan to purchase used clothing wholesale to sell at street fairs.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing wholesale to sell at street markets.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn is 57 years old, married and lives in Poblacion, Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte. She operates a hog-raising business which is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC. Her quarterly income of approximately PHP 20,000.00 sufficiently provides for the needs of her family. Recently, she has taken out another loan to buy piglets & purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to buy piglets & purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Miguel, Jr.

texts.en:
Miguel Jr. is a businessman from Piao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. He is 44 years old, married and has expertise in selling. He runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports his family.

Miguel Jr. is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. He maintains his membership in good standing without records of default. Now, he has applied for a loan to restock his store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

Miguel Jr. continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that he has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for his family.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie  joined PMPC in 2012 and has always regarded Paglaum MPC as a rescuer for lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she is seeking another loan for the next cropping season. She will use the loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation. Rosie perseveres and always believes that she will reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita makes a living through her retail business. She runs a lumberyard in Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte and earns a promising income to support her family.

She has signed up to be a member of PMPC to gain access to capital. She wants to increase her inventory. Now, she has taken out a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

Leonita hopes to sustain her business and dreams of sending all of her children to school.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

location.town: Sindangan - Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Esperanza está en su ciclo número 1, es de la ciudad de Caacupé, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, se unieron para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
La señora Maria, ayuda al Sostenimiento de su familia con la venta de Dulces que realiza día a día, comenta que tiene muchos clientes ya que sus dulces son muy ricos. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que se esfuerza mucho para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus dulces, como frutas, azúcar, elementos de cocina y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad de poder crecer y mejorar a través del programa de comités.
texts.en:
The La Esperanza Group (Hope Group) is in its first loan cycle. The group is formed by a group of friends and neighbors in the city of Caacupé, who have joined together to be able to grow and improve the living conditions of their loved ones.

Maria helps support her family by selling sweets each day. She has many clients, because her sweets are so delicious. She is a very determined woman, who tries very hard to be able to give her loved ones what she was unable to have.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making sweets, such as fruit, sugar, and cooking implements, among other items. She is very grateful for the opportunity to grow and improve that she has received through the committee program.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making sweets, such as fruit, sugar, cooking implements, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients for making meals, like vegetables, meat, seasonings, greens, chicken, and other products.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Proboste Group

texts.es:
Andreyna continúa con su negocio de venta de artesanía (sentada la segunda de la izquierda, viste mangas azules). El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó para comprar material de trabajo para su negocio, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque tuvo buenas ventas. Actualmente la banca continúa trabajando y mejorando sus ingresos, su negocio sigue prosperando, su artesanía se vende por mayor y menor, “todo el tiempo estoy creando nuevo modelos y figuras artesanales…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende por mayor y menor, la desventaja es la falta de material de trabajo para realizar artesanías. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de artesanía, ella desea comprar material de trabajo como cuero, cerámica, metales y otros. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Andreyna solicita un préstamo para comprar material de trabajo para realizar artesanía en cuero.
texts.en:
Andreyna continues with her business selling crafts (she is seated second from the left, wearing the jacket with blue sleeves). She used the loan she obtained to purchase working materials for her business, and her payments were on time because she had good sales.

Currently, the members of the communal bank continue working and improving their incomes. Andreyna’s business is prospering and she sells her crafts at the bulk and retail levels. She comments, “I am always creating new kinds of crafts.” The advantage of her business is that she sells at the bulk and retail levels, and the disadvantage is the lack of working materials to make crafts.

Her dream is to open handicraft shop. She wants to purchase working materials including leather, ceramic, and metal. This is her second loan cycle with this institution in the seven years that she has been working in this profession. It is for these reasons that Andreyna is requesting a loan to purchase working materials to make leather crafts.

loans.use: to purchase working materials to make leather crafts.

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.en:
Cayetana is a rice grower in Lagag, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She finds pleasure in doing her farming activities and making a good living for her family.

As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she is seeking financial help to purchase rice seeds that will have good results, giving healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

In the future, Cayetana wishes to become the rice supplier of the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results, giving healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Diego Albenis

texts.es:
Diego es un campesino de 35 años de edad, dedicado a trabajar como mayordomo en diferentes fincas de la región. Con los ahorros que pudo recolectar durante tantos años de arduo trabajo pudo adquirir un lote de tierra con casa, en la que comenzó a cultivar maíz, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del pueblo; un tiempo después, con el apoyo de un crédito en una entidad financiera, pudo adquirir otra finca pequeña junto a su vivienda y en el momento se encuentra en proceso de sembrar para aumentar su producción.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de semillas de maíz, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas y pagará la mano de obra, esto le ayudará a mejorar sus cultivos y tendrá una cosecha más productiva, generando así mayor nivel de ingresos.

Poco a poco Diego va construyendo su futuro con el apoyo de su esposa, y cada vez avanza un paso más para poder terminar de cancelar la deuda de la finca que adquirió y mejorarla, aumentando sus cultivos y organizando la estructura de la casa, pues se encuentra en mal estado; todo esto dará como resultado la generación de progreso y mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Diego is a farmer of 35 years of age, who has worked as a caretaker on different farms in the region. With the savings he was able to make during so many years of hard work, he was able to acquire a plot of land with a house, where he began to cultivate maize, whose crops are harvested and sold in the village market. Some time after, with the support of a loan from a financial institution, he was able to buy another small farm at the side of his house, and right now is in the process of planting to increase production. 

The loan that he has requested will be invested in the purchase of maize seed, manure, fertilizers and pesticides, and will pay for labor. This will help improve his crops and have a more productive harvest, generating a higher income level. Little by little, Diego is building his future with the support of his wife, and each time he gets a step closer to canceling the debt of the farm he purchased, and improving the farm, increasing the crop yields and fixing the structure of the house, since it is in poor condition. All of this will result in progress, better living conditions and the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to purchase maize seed, manure, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Other people perceive the task of managing a “sari-sari” (variety) store as a simple “wait and sell” practice. It’s not that effortless. Nenita of Bacolod City, Negros Occidental has to get up from bed for a customer who knocks at 4:30am to buy one egg worth PHP 6. At times, she stays until past midnight waiting for a group to finish their midnight snack in front of her store.

Nenita needs to be patient indeed, so customers will patronize her store. It’s a good thing that her husband, Eduardo, a barangay peace officer, takes a turn in looking after the store when he’s not on duty. Occasionally, she also asks her grandchildren to watch over the store after school.

Nenita wants to maintain her business because it’s a good source of their everyday sustenance. It has contributed a lot in providing for her children’s needs and education. Now she uses her income to extend financial help to her grandchildren. In the Philippines, where families are known to be so closely knit, parents’ responsibilities don’t just end with their children but also extend to their grandchildren as long as they can. In return, grandchildren are always there to assist and accompany their grandparents.

As Nenita continues to improve her variety store business, she wants to obtain PHP 32,000 in supplementary capital to buy more dry goods, grocery items, and soft drinks to enhance her inventory. Your kind support will surely extend to her whole family and grandchildren. She consistently meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire each other through sharing of life’s testimonies and reflection on the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods, grocery items, and soft drinks to enhance her inventory.

loans.name: Zuly Maritza

texts.es:
Laboriosa y soñadora, son dos palabras que describen perfectamente a Zuly, una mujer trabajadora y de familia, que hace lo que este a su alcance para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposo.

Se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos en el municipio de Caparrapi.
Esta es una actividad muy común en esta región y gran parte de sus habitantes la practican.

Ella posee gran conocimiento en esta materia y considera que necesita un pequeño impulso para incrementar sus ventas y aumentar su negocio, es por esta razón que solicita un auxilio económico para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos de engorde, alimento y materiales para el mantenimiento del corral donde alberga sus animales.

Con este préstamo podrá continuar con su actividad que es la única fuente de ingresos de su familia.

Se siente agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva y con la Corporación Interactuar que hacen posible que su negocio crezca y mejore.
texts.en:
'Hard-working' and a 'dreamer' are two words that perfectly describe Zuly, a family woman and worker. She does whatever she can to offer a better quality of life to her children and husband.

She works raising and selling pigs in the town of Caparrapi. This is a very common activity in the area and many people do it. She possesses great knowledge in this matter, and thinks that a small boost is needed to increase her sales and improve her business. It is for this reason she is asking for some financial aid to invest in the purchase of pigs to fatten, pig feed, and materials to maintain the pig enclosure. 

With this loan, she can continue with her work, which is the only source of money for her family. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders and Corporación Interactuar, who made it possible for her business to grow and improve.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for fattening, feed, and materials for the maintenance of the animal enclosure

loans.name: Francisco Candelario

texts.es:
Candelario, de 63 años de edad, no sabe leer ni escribir, está acompañado y junto a su mujer tuvo dos hijos, los cuales le ayudan mucho con sus trabajos agrícolas.

Candelario, desde que estaba joven trabajaba en la agricultura, porque le ayudaba a un señor que tenía una hacienda y ahí cuidaba ganado de repasto; pero desde hace más de 20 años decidió trabajar sus propios cultivos y ha obtenido buenos resultados; actualmente está trabajando tres hectáreas de maíz con la ayuda de su hijo.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar fertilizantes para aplicarlo a sus cultivos, para asegurar una buena producción.

Su sueño es tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Candelario, 63 years old, doesn't know how to read or write, has a partner, and, together with his partner, has two children, who help him with much of the farm work. Candelario has worked in farming since he was young, because he helped a man who owned a ranch, where he looked after cattle in the pasture.

However, for more than 20 years, he has grown his own crops and obtained good results. He is currently working three acres of corn with the help of his son. The loan that he is requesting is to buy fertilizer to apply to his crops, to ensure a good yield. His dream is to have a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to apply to his crops to ensure a good yield.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es: Edilberto, de 47 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, vive solo junto a su hermana en el municipio de Petoa, Santa Bárbara.  El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura con la siembra de maíz y frijol, lleva 6 años de dedicarse al cultivo de plátano el que vende en el mercado de la localidad. Esta actividad la realiza en una parcela de terreno aparte de su hogar con la que el cuenta. Actualmente el solicita la cantidad de 20,000.00 Lempiras para poder invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de plátano, con cual planea darle una mejor asistencia para obtener una buena cosecha que le ayude a aumentar sus ingresos. A futuro  piensa invertir las ganancias obtenidas en la compra de un vehículo que le ayude a transportar las cargas de plátanos para seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Edilberto is 47 years old. He has two children. He lives with his sister in the municipality of Petoa, Santa Barbara. He has always worked in agriculture, growing corn and beans. For 6 years he has worked cultivating bananas that he sells in the market in his area. He does this on a parcel of land, in addition to his house, that he has.

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 HNL to be able to invest in the purchase of fertilizers to maintain his cultivation of bananas. He plans to give improved assistance to his crop in order to obtain a good harvest that will help him to increase his income. In the future he is thinking of investing his earnings in the purchase of a vehicle that would help him to transport the bananas in order to continue expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the maintenance of his banana crop.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.en:
Before moving to the United States in 1984, Lucio was an electronics technician in Peru. When he came to Perth Amboy, he was unable to get a job as a technician - a trade he both loved and was good at. Instead, he found a job as a bus driver and worked hard for five years, saving as much money as he could so that he could start his own electronics repair shop.

In 1989, Lucio opened his own store in downtown Perth Amboy. For the last 25 years, Lucio has been helping local Perth Amboy residents to save money by performing quality repairs on customers' personal electronics. Lucio offers repair services for TVs, personal computers, and audio equipment. For each repair, Lucio charges for parts, labor, and sales tax. His business has low expenses, as he already owns many of the repair machines and tools he needs, and customer payments cover most of the cost of purchasing new parts.

Right now, Lucio has a few projects in his shop that require special equipment he does not own. He is seeking a loan to purchase necessary equipment to complete these repairs. The equipment will enable him to serve more customers in the future.

A Kiva loan from you will allow Lucio to purchase new parts to complete these repairs and continue serving his local community's electronics needs.

loans.use: to purchase supplies needed to repair the electronics in his inventory.

loans.name: Norma Esperanza

texts.es: Norma, de 21 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo en una aldea del Municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Norma tiene 4 años de dedicarse al cultivo de café y frijoles en su propia finca junto a su esposo de esta manera ella comercializa café en pergamino y frijoles en su localidad para obtener ingresos. Ella solicita la cantidad de 4,000.00 Lempiras para invertir en la compra de más semillas de frijol, insumos y pago de mano de obra para la siembra, y fertilización del cultivo de frijol. Mediante esta asistencia estará logrando mejor cosecha y rendimiento y también podrá ofrecer productos de mejor calidad y en mayores cantidades. Ella Planea invertir las ganancias para poner otro negocio, mejorar su casa y ampliar el área del café para un mayor aumento en sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Norma, 21 years of age, lives with her husband and son in a village in the Municipality of Gracias, in Lempira. Norma has been dedicated to cultivating coffee and beans for four years on her own farm along with her husband's. She sells her coffee in Pergamino and sells her beans locally, both in order to obtain her income.

Norma is requesting 4,000 Lempiras to invest in purchasing more bean seeds, and needed inputs, plus laborers for planting and fertilizing her bean plants. By means of this assistance, she will achieve a better harvest and greater productivity. Also, she can offer products of better quality and in larger quantities.

Norma plans to invest the earnings in starting another business, improving her house, and expanding the area allotted to coffee, in order to improve her income.

loans.use: purchase bean seeds and needed inputs, and to pay for laborers to plant and fertilize the beans.

loans.name: Junta De Saneamientos De Minas Y Guayaibity Group

texts.es:
La Junta De Saneamientos De Minas y Guayaibity fue creada el 6 de octubre del año 2009 y desde la fecha hasta hoy en día provee del líquido imprescindible a los vecinos de la zona de Mariano Roque Alonso.
Actualmente la junta de saneamiento cuenta con dos pozos y un tanque de hormigón, la distribución de agua y todos los usuarios cuentan con medidores en su totalidad, lo que permite ayudarles a tener este servicio importante. Gracias a esta aguatería 757 usuarios pueden tener agua y de esa forma tener acceso a algo tan imprescindible para todo ser humano.
 Solicitan el prestamo para la compra de medidores y caños, con lo cual desean poder seguir haciendo llegar a las personas este servicio tan importante.
Esta aguatería está ayudando a las personas con este servicio tan grande y es por eso que piden este crédito para poder ir creciendo y que más personas tengan acceso a este servicio.
texts.en:
"The Health Board of Minas y Guayaibity" was created on October 6, 2009, and since then has been providing water to the neighbors of the zone Mariano Roque Alonso. The Health Board has two wells and one concrete tank. They distribute the water to the neighbors who all have gauges allowing them to have this important service. The water distribution system serves 757 users allowing them access to this essential need for every human being.
They are requesting the loan to buy gauges and pipes in order to keep providing their customers with this important service. This water distribution system is helping the people with this service and that's why they are requesting the loan so they can continue growing and allow more people to have access to this service.

loans.use: to buy gauges and pipes to expand their water distribution system.

loans.name: Flor Del Rio Group

texts.en:
The municipality of Patzité, bathed amongst rushing rivers, is located in the southern part of the Department of Quiché, in Central Guatemala, with a temperate climate. It is about 174 kilometers from Guatemala city. The economy in this town is based in agriculture, with many inhabitants growing products such as wheat, corn, and beans. The people of Patzité also practice artisanry, weaving cotton, tackle, ropes and hats from palm leaves, as well as candlemaking, and the production of bricks and red-clay pottery.

“Flor del Río,” or “River Flower” trust bank is a group of 10 women from the young age of 20 to 55 years old who speak Spanish and Quiché. Sixty percent of these ladies had the opportunity to study to 6th grade, and all of them are merchants in and outside of their town.

Juana, a young woman of only 23 years, is leading the group as president. Married and raising her 2-year-old son, Juana is a primary school teacher, but also a businesswoman, working with her husband to sell pork in the market, and also “granizadas,” which are delicious icees of different flavors with fruit.

With the credit she receives, Juana plans to buy 10 pigs, and flavorings and fruit for her granizadas. Her dream is to grow her business into a small shop outside of the city, where she will sell food and snacks.

These women are determined to save up their money, grow their businesses, and succeed as managers of micro-enterprises, making up a fundamental part of their local economies. These goals are within reach, thanks to the support of people who believe in these women entrepreneurs working to eliminate poverty and benefit them by investing in credit.

loans.use: to buy 10 pigs for resale.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia has always been enthusiastic about farming. She has cultivated her rice land in Poblacion, Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Letecia knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this crop season.

In the future, Letecia hopes to buy a truck to easily transport and haul produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Lagag, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jump start her corn production.

After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Virginia feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business.

Recently, she took out a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next crop season. Virginia wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 67 years old and married with 4 adult age children who are now professionals.

She pawned her land when her youngest daughter was finishing college. Luckily, she had signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC that allows her access to a loan so that she can redeem her pawned land.

loans.use: to redeem pawned land

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda makes a living through her fishing operation activities. She runs a fishing business in Lawis, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte and earns a promising income to support her family.

She has signed up for membership with PMPC to buy plywood, nails & hollow blocks for the construction of her house. She wants to renovate her house for her family. Linda hopes to sustain her fishing business to maintain her good membership with the cooperative.

loans.use: to buy plywood, nails & hollow blocks for the construction of her house.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a dedicated farmer of 10 years' experience. She has been doing well in farming, supplying vegetables and spices to the local market and thereby supporting the needs of her family.

Lolita first joined Paglaum MPC for capitalization of her farming activities. She has mastered the craft of land preparation, seedbed preparation, replanting, trellising, harvesting and post harvest operation. She is requesting this loan to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca lives in Dili B. She is married and is a businesswoman. She is applying for a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.

She has a shop in the center of the market, so many people come to buy. Francisca has been involved in business activities since a few years ago. She started with her own working capital. She is earning a good income from selling second hand clothes so she is still happy to do her business.

She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more second-hand clothes, including housedresses, skirts, women's and men's shirts, turtleneck shirts, undershirts and other things.

loans.use: to buy housedresses, skirts, women's and men's shirts, turtleneck shirts, undershirts and other things.

loans.name: Deoneti

texts.en:
Deoneti is a 28-year-old single woman who works hard to support her family as a teacher. Although the family works very hard, it can be cumbersome for her to afford the cost of her brother's education.

This loan of $800 will allow Deoneti to help her brother's studies and will be utilized from senior high school to university. She will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks and school supplies.

Deoneti hopes that in the future they will be happy in the family.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks and school supplies.

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
Carmen, sin contar con mucho capital pero manteniendo las ganas de salir adelante que siempre la han caracterizado, se vio en la obligación de encontrar una fuente de ingresos que le permitiera aportar económicamente al sostenimiento de su hogar, pues los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para poder sostener todos los gastos. 

Carmen se encuentra casada y tiene 4 hijos, quienes siempre han sido la motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio. 

Carmen decidió montar un negocio de billares y venta de licor en un espacio adecuado para este fin.

 Por la buena atención que ofrece y la buena calidad de sus productos, Carmen ha captado un gran número de clientes que le garantizan muy buenas ventas en su negocio, a tal punto que la necesidad de capital se vuelve una dificultad constante para poder responder a la demanda que hacen sus clientes. 

Con el ánimo de poder mejorar su inventario, Carmen busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de surtido de licor y gaseosas.

Carmen espera que con esta compra pueda seguir respondiendo a los pedidos que le hacen y pueda seguir aumentando su capital para que su negocio siga creciendo cada vez más. 

Además, espera que con mayores ingresos sus hijos y su esposo puedan gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y poder también cumplir su sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda
texts.en:
Carmen doesn't have much capital but maintains the desire she has always had to get ahead. She was obliged to find a source of income that would allow her to economically contribute to the sustenance of her household as the income her husband generates isn't sufficient to cover all the expenses.

Carmen is married and has four children who have always been her motivation to work hard at her business.

Carmen decide to open a pool hall and sell liquor in a space adapted for this purpose. Because of the good service she provides and the quality of her products Carmen has gained a large number of clients which guarantees her good sales in her business.To the point that the need of capital has become a constant difficulty so as to be able to respond to the demand from her clients.

With the aim of to be able to improve her inventory, Carmen is looking for a loan that will provide her the possibility of buying an assortment of liquor and soft drinks.

Carmen hopes that with this purchase she can continue to meet the demand her clients have and can augment her capital so her business continues to grow more. Also with the increased income she hopes that her children and husband can enjoy a better quality of living and also be able to achieve her dream of improving the condition of her house.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of liquor and soft drinks.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama San Cayetano, se formó en la ciudad de Itá, todas ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras que quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través del trabajo unido y en conjunto. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose y luchando por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gabriela quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, comenta que por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Ella comenta que se unió al grupo para poder capacitarse y mejorar su humilde emprendimiento, es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, que se esfuerza por sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, como ser: remeras, camisas, pantalones, jeans, blusas y otros, y de esa forma poder surtirse y poder continuar con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano Group, based in the city of Itá, is formed by a group of hard-working women who want to improve their living conditions by working together. They are part of the poverty elimination project, and are working hard and with determination to improve their lives.

Gabriela is one of the group's members. She works selling clothing, and says that she is able to help her loved ones with her earnings. She says that she joined the group to receive training, and to improve her humble business. She is a hard-working woman with lots of initiative, who tries her hardest to help her loved ones.

She is requesting this loan to buy clothing such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, jeans, blouses and other items, so that she can stock her business and be able to continue making a living from sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, jeans, blouses, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is known in the Calamba area for her copra production business. She has been into this business for almost 10 years and is making good proceeds from it.

This business ventures enables her to provide for the needs of her family. She is now asking for a loan from Paglaum MPC to buy coconut for copra (smoked/dried coconut meat) production.

loans.use: to buy coconut for copra (smoked/dried coconut meat) production

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring, harvesting and earning income as well. Elena has supported her husband doing this type of work.

Like a farmer, Elena has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

Someday, Elena hopes to purchase additional rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 43 years old and married with three school-age children. She is a vegetable grower in Calamba, Misamis Occidental and had supplied vegetables in her local market.

She is also an active member of Paglaum MPC, where she accesses its financial services for her farming activities. Recently, she has asked the coop for a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is selling firewood for household and industrial use. She's making good sales from this business activity, enabling her to help her husband in providing for their growing family needs.

She started up her business with the initial capital handed to her by Paglaum MPC and successfully managed her accounts without records of default. Recently, she has availed herself of a loan to buy more firewood to resell.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to resell

loans.name: Margarita Ester

texts.es:
Margarita, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tienen en común 1 hijo de 6 años de edad.

Margarita, tiene una tienda en su casa, está muy bien ubicación porque es un lugar donde transitan muchas personas.- Anteriormente, ella se dedicaba a vender en una tienda donde le pagaban por su servicio y fue de ahí donde obtuvo experiencia para vender y los ingresos suficientes para colocar su propio negocio. 

Margarita, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, aceite, frijoles, maíz, entre otros; el préstamo le servirá para  mejorar los ingresos de la familia y poder cubrir las necesidades de su hijo.
